Post ID:3184
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-03-09 12:36:27
Subject:SUPPORT THE CUBAN FIVE!!
Message:

URGENT ALERT ABOUT THE CUBAN FIVE/
March 7th, 2003

URGENT ALERT: The Cuban 5 have been placed in solidarity confinement and
they need your help!

The five Cuban political prisoners in the U.S. were suddenly and without
justification thrown into solitary confinement on March 3, 2003 in their
separate prisons. It is not clear how long the punishment will last.

Prison authorities have not given the official reason for their illegal
confinement in "the hole", but apparently it is a decision
from the Federal Bureau of Prisons in Washington, and has the markings of 
directed political repression against the Five.

As Leonard Weinglass, appeals attorney for Antonio Guerrero, one of the
Cuban Five in Florence Colorado prison, said, "None of them
belongs in solitary confinement. It is completely unjustified and
unnecessary as all of them are model prisoners."

Weinglass has urged supporters of the Cuban Five to write immediately
to the Federal Bureau of Prisons in Washington. We ask that you do not 
writeto the individual prisons, as they are not responsible for the 
confinementorder.

The address of the Federal Bureau of Prisons is:
320 First St. N.W.
Washington DC 20534.

The telephone number is 202-307-3198.
Hours are Monday-Friday, 8 am to 5 pm.

Weinglass noted in an interview with Radio Havana Cuba yesterday that the 
Black Panther prisoners in the U.S. were similarly rounded up
into solitary right after 9/11. (Read the complete interview with Weinglass 
after this notice.)

There is speculation that they are being confined just as the U.S.
government is preparing for a massive war against Iraq.

It is no coincidence that the Justice Department's repression of Arab,
Muslim and immigrant communities is also being aimed against the Cuban Five, 
whose only "crime" was fighting U.S.-sponsored terrorism against Cuba.

Gerardo Hern�ndez, Ram�n Laba�ino, Antonio Guerrero, Ren� Gonz�lez, and 
Fernando Gonz�lez have been imprisoned since September 1998
when they were arrested by the FBI on trumped-up charges of espionage on the 
United States. In reality they were prosecuted by the U.S. for
defending their country of Cuba from U.S.-sponsored and supported terrorism 
that emanates from Miami.

The Five lived in Miami since the early 1990s where they were on a vital
mission of monitoring anti-Cuba terrorist groups there to prevent violence 
against their country of Cuba. More than 3,400 Cubans have been killed by 
the anti-Cuba violence.

At two of the prisons on Friday, Cuba 5 supporters were ready to visit the 
compa�eros when they were turned away. Reverend Geoff Bottoms flew in from 
Blackpool, England to see Ram�n Laba�ino in Beaumont federal prison in exas. 
He was told without explanation that Ram�n was not permitted visitors.

Alicia Jrapko and Tanya Cole were at Lompoc prison to visit Gerardo
Hern�ndez. Jrapko was told, "It is possible they will not get any
more visitors other than their family in the future."

We ask all supporters to write to the Bureau of Prisons, expressing your
concern for their safety, and that you protest the unjust and
unnecessary solitary confinement. Their exemplary behavior does not warrant 
this kind of treatment. There is reason to believe they are singled out 
because they are political prisoners.

It is also essential that their attorneys have full and unrestricted access 
to their clients, especially at this critical time while they're preparing 
for the April 7th appeals court date in Atlanta. Weinglass was unable to 
speak with Antonio for two days although he had
authorized collect calls from him.

It is undoubtedly very stressful for their family members. They had only
just returned to Cuba, after coming to the U.S. to visit their loved ones.
The families had been delayed their entry visas by the
U.S. government for more than six months. Two of the wives, Olga Salanueva
and Adriana Perez are still prohibited from entering the U.S.

2) Radio Havana Cuba Interview with Leonard Weinglass Commenting on the
Change in Status of the Five Cuban Political Prisoners in the US.
7th March 2003

Bernie Dwyer: Good evening, Mr. Weinglass. The president of the Cuban
Parliament, Ricardo Alarc�n announced during the first sitting of the
new Cuban National Assembly, Thursday March 6 that the five Cuban political
prisoners in the United States have been returned to isolation status in
their various penitential centers. Can you comment on that?

Leonard Weinglass: "Yes, I've been informed of this and
I've been in contact with the prison authorities for Antonio Guerrero out in
Colorado and they haven't been cooperating at all. I'm still trying
to reach Antonio to talk to him directly. Moving the five into isolation at
this time is an utterly unnecessary and irrational act,
which can only be motivated by a desire to increase their punishment and
have them held under even more harsh conditions than they have been held
under before. I don't see any justification for this
whatsoever. After 9/11 the government put all of the black panthers who are
held in various prisons throughout the United States also into isolation
which was an unjustified act and had nothing whatever
to do with whatever national crisis the government was claiming. I regard
this as probably the same as what happened to the Black
Panthers merely because they were political people being held for political
reasons, they were buried into an isolation status and I'm
afraid that that is happening with the five".

Bernie Dwyer: Mr. Weinglass, Are you saying that because of the impending US
war against Iraq, the five are now being treated as a security risk?

Leonard Weinglass: "Well, we can only guess at that because they refuse to
answer my enquiries about why that are doing this but the fact that they did
it to all five indicates that it is a policy decision and not the result of
any act of any one or any five of them. I do believe that it is related to
that although I haven't
had any official confirmation of it but as your question indicates, it is
completely irrational and unnecessary and not related to any security
concern of an realistic nature that the prison authorities might have".

Bernie Dwyer: Exactly what kinds of rights and privileges have been cut
back?

Leonard Weinglass: "Once you're put in isolation you
virtually lose all your rights. It's a very extreme and heightened form of
punishment. The only people you can communicate with are your
attorneys. Antonio was a teacher at the prison and I presume that he is not
permitted to teach. He is not permitted contact with others and he is held
in complete isolation. This is a very harsh form of punishment and it is
usually reserved for people who have violated major security provisions
within the institution. The
fact that the five are put there because of any imaginary national crisis
that is happening in the US has absolutely no relationship to any crisis".

Bernie Dwyer: You mentioned that the only person they can have contact with
is their attorney but it seems that even that particular right is not being
honored at the moment.

Leonard Weinglass: "You're right. I have been trying for two
days to talk to Antonio. They promised me that I could talk to him
yesterday.
I fulfilled all the requirements by writing letters, etc.,
authorizing Tony to call me collect but they haven't permitted him to use
the telephone. Not even that restricted right has been honored by the prison
authorities so far".

Bernie Dwyer: Mr. Weinglass, do you know of any other political prisoners
from other countries that that might be getting the same treatment?

Leonard Weinglass: "I have inquired from attorneys I know who have been
representing people from the Middle East who are being held in
various prisons and none has been able to give me any affirmative
information so I am not sure now how many are being put in this
condition or if any others are in fact but I hope sometime today to get an
confirmation from these attorneys as to the status of their clients".

Bernie Dwyer: To your knowledge, how long has this situation pertained?

Leonard Weinglass: "I was first notified of it on Wednesday
morning, the 5th and I don't know when it began but that was my first notice
of it. I found out while discussing the appeal with other attorneys
representing five. During the course of us discussing matters relating to
the appeal, one of the other attorneys indicated that he is unable to
communicate with his client. I then immediately began to
enquire about Antonio's status and I was informed that he was, in fact in
isolation. But they refused to tell me why".

Bernie Dwyer: Is there any positive actions that the solidarity groups and
the general public can take to support the five Cuban political prisoners to
roll back some of the problems that they are having at the moment?

Leonard Weinglass: "I think that the support network should be mobilized and
should contact the Bureau of Prisons and issue statements of complaint about
this condition and support for the five. In the past when the American Civil
Liberties Union or Amnesty
International has complained about an unjust change of status, frequently
the Bureau does back down so I would think that people should be
communicating to the Bureau of Prisons that the five should not be held in
this condition".

This interview was aired on Radio Havana Cuba on Friday, March 7 2003.Cuban
Five Are Placed in Solitary Confinement Without Explanation

3) The newly re-elected President of the Cuban National Assembly, Ricardo
Alarc�n, has condemned further abuses against the five Cuban political
prisoners in the United States.
In an address to the first gathering of the Assembly since general elections
in January, he said that all five had been placed in solitary confinement
without any reason given and that their attorneys were unable to visit them.

"We hope - he said - that the authorities, which staged the new violation of
the Five prisoners� human rights (proving their never-ending cruelty
capability), are able to put an end to the obstacles presented that prevent
them from being visited by their attorneys and such an unjustifiable action
right away. We ratify our commitment to keep on fighting to finish with this
injustice and get their freedom".

Alarc�n demanded that the United States Government grant access to the Five
by their lawyers, and decried their confinement in the "hole" as an abuse of
their human rights. All five Cubans suffered 17 months of solitary
confinement after they were arrested on September 12th, 1998. They all
reside in different prisons deliberately spread across the entire expanse of
the United States.

(Courtesy of antiterroristas.cu)


Fernando Garc�a Bielsa
First Secretary
Cuba's Interests Section
2630 16th Street, NW
Washington, DC 20009
Ph. (202)797-8518, ext 109
Fax (202)797-8521

The Latin American Solidarity Conference website can be found at
www.lasolidarity.org

Subject:Jericho-March 28th
Message:

Fifth Anniversary of the Jericho Movement!!

Come celebrate the 5th Anniversary of the founding of the Jericho Movement 
with a rededication and recommitment to the work of freeing our Political 
Prisoners and Prisoners of War!!

MCs-Esperanza Martell, ProLibertad and Lumumba Akinwole-Bandele, Malcolm X 
Grassroots Movement

Program:
Meet the New Jericho Board
Pam Africa
NYC Council Member Charles Baron
Rev. Lucius Walker
Laura Whitehorn

AND MANY MANY MORE...

Also, their will be food, music, performances, videos of Political
Prisoners, Solidarity Statements and MORE...

Friday March 28th, 2003 6pm-10pm
St. Mary's Church W126th St. (between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue)
(Take the 1,9, A, D, C, trains to W125th St.)

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more info. email Jerichonatl@... or call 212-502-1143
http://www.thejerichomovement.com

_______________________________________________________________________

Free the 5 Cuban Political Prisoners!

Come Hear Defense Attorney Len Weinglass
Speak on the Case of the Cuban Five, May 8th


Criminal defense attorney Len Weinglass is currently
representing Cuban Antonio Guerrero in prison in Colorado
convicted of conspiracy along with four fellow Cubans, all
serving long sentences in American prisons. The Cuban Five
attempted to thwart the terrorism of Miami-based Cuban
counter-revolutionaries by documenting their activities and
turning the information over to the U.S. government in the hopes
that our government would stem the violence directed against
Cuba.

The government reciprocated, not by intervening against the
terrorists, but instead arrested the five Cubans on frame-up
charges and convicted them in Miami, where the intimidating
climate made a fair trial impossible. Weinglass has represented
defendants in significant political cases including Tom Hayden,
the Pentagon Papers, the Chicago Seven, Kathy Boudin, and most
recently Mumia Abu Jamal.

Date: Thursday, May 8, 2003
Time: 7:30 pm
Place: The Brecht Forum
122 West 27th Street, 10th floor
Manhattan, New York City

Transportation Information: Take the IRT #1 subway train to 28th
Street or the IND "F" subway train to 23rd Street.

Suggested Donation: $6/$8/$10

For more information please call the Brecht Forum at (212)242-4201.

Free the 5 Cuban Political Prisoners!

Come Hear Defense Attorney Len Weinglass
Speak on the Case of the Cuban Five, May 8th


Criminal defense attorney Len Weinglass is currently
representing Cuban Antonio Guerrero in prison in Colorado
convicted of conspiracy along with four fellow Cubans, all
serving long sentences in American prisons. The Cuban Five
attempted to thwart the terrorism of Miami-based Cuban
counter-revolutionaries by documenting their activities and
turning the information over to the U.S. government in the hopes
that our government would stem the violence directed against
Cuba.

The government reciprocated, not by intervening against the
terrorists, but instead arrested the five Cubans on frame-up
charges and convicted them in Miami, where the intimidating
climate made a fair trial impossible. Weinglass has represented
defendants in significant political cases including Tom Hayden,
the Pentagon Papers, the Chicago Seven, Kathy Boudin, and most
recently Mumia Abu Jamal.

Free the 5 Cuban Political Prisoners!

Come Hear Defense Attorney Len Weinglass
Speak on the Case of the Cuban Five, May 8th


Criminal defense attorney Len Weinglass is currently
representing Cuban Antonio Guerrero in prison in Colorado
convicted of conspiracy along with four fellow Cubans, all
serving long sentences in American prisons. The Cuban Five
attempted to thwart the terrorism of Miami-based Cuban
counter-revolutionaries by documenting their activities and
turning the information over to the U.S. government in the hopes
that our government would stem the violence directed against
Cuba.

The government reciprocated, not by intervening against the
terrorists, but instead arrested the five Cubans on frame-up
charges and convicted them in Miami, where the intimidating
climate made a fair trial impossible. Weinglass has represented
defendants in significant political cases including Tom Hayden,
the Pentagon Papers, the Chicago Seven, Kathy Boudin, and most
recently Mumia Abu Jamal.

Date: Thursday, May 8, 2003
Time: 7:30 pm
Place: The Brecht Forum
122 West 27th Street, 10th floor
Manhattan, New York City

Transportation Information: Take the IRT #1 subway train to 28th
Street or the IND "F" subway train to 23rd Street.

Suggested Donation: $6/$8/$10

For more information please call the Brecht Forum at (212)242-4201.
________________________________________________________________________

March 17, 2003
IMPORTANT: LATEST UPDATE:
From the National Committee to Free the Five Cuban Political
Prisoners in the United States
415-821-6545. fax: 415-821-5782. www.freethefive.org

Dear Friends of the Cuban Five:
A small but very important step toward freeing our five brothers
from the isolation cells they've been locked in, was achieved.
Two days ago, the attorneys' rights to visit their clients was
restored. For the last three weeks, not even the five appeals
lawyers were allowed to see or talk with the five Cuban
anti-terrorist heroes. However, the lawyer-client privilege of
confidentiality is still denied, as monitoring of their conversations
will be instituted.

The cells that Gerardo, Fernando, Rene, Ramon and Antonio
have been imprisoned in are tiny, with lights on 24 hours a day,
no way to know if it is night or day, and no contact with other
people. This is psychological torture and nothing less, meant to
punish the Five Cuban heroes, who have never faltered in their
defense of their country and principles of justice.

Their isolation is keeping them from contacts with their families
and attorneys, and constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.
Unfortunately, many thousands of prisoners in the U.S. are in the
same isolation cells (SHUs) that have been roundly condemned
for their cruelty.

This last week, a mass mobilization was launched through the
Internet, by the Cuban 5 committees in the U.S. and around the
world. Many hundreds of calls and e-mails were made to
Attorney General John Ashcroft and Bureau of Prison director
Kathleen Hawk Sawyer, demanding their release from the "hole."
By all your actions, we let the government know we are vigilant of
the situation and protest every punitive move against the Five
Cuban brothers, and that we will continue to struggle for their
freedom.

Keep the pressure up! Don't stop calling or e-mailing the
Attorney General and the Bureau of Prisons to call for their
immediate release from isolation. Please organize a meeting in
your community on the Five. Check our website:
www.freethefive.org for the available resources and to see how
you can help.

According to Antonio Guerrero's attorney Leonard Weinglass, the
solitary confinement is part of a "special administrative" order,
from the Attorney General to the BOP for implementation. The
order claims that the Five's contacts with other people � by mail
or in person - could result in the unauthorized disclosure of
information that "could pose a threat to the national security of
the United States."

This is a complete fabrication as the Five brothers never had
anything to with information related to U.S. national security, or
classified material. They were protecting Cuba from the Miami
terrorists, unless the U.S. government considers the terrorists
part of their "national security."

The order lasts for one year and can be extended at any time by
Ashcroft.

Severe restrictions on their communication with the outside
world are in effect. Please be very conscious of the difficulties
they face at the moment. Please write to them to give them
encouragement and the warmth of your friendship and solidarity,
although if you see the urgent update about Gerardo Hern�ndez,
he is not getting ANYTHING to read. They may only be able to
respond with a very limited number of letters, because they are
given only a few stamps in the "hole." So far only Fernando
Gonz�lez has been able to write.

We will keep you posted. Please contact us if you have any
questions. Again, thank you all for your great responses. Free
the Five!


From the "Antiterrorism Working Group of the Cuban National
Parliament"
GRAVE VIOLATIONS AGAINST GERARDO HERNANDEZ
We urge all people who read this notice to let all your friends,
families, and colleagues know about it. It is very important.


March 17th, 2003
After frequent requests were made to Assistant United States
Attorney Caroline Heck Miller in Florida, on Sunday, March 16th,
US attorney Leonard Weinglass was able to gain permission to
visit Gerardo Hern�ndez - a visit that already had been planned
back in February before all of the Cuban Five were placed in
solitary confinement.

According to Weinglass, Gerardo is undergoing the most severe
punishment in his prison in Lompoc, California, where he is
confined to what is known as "the Box" within the Special
Housing Unit -a hole within the "Hole". He has been under this
regimen since February 28th when he was transferred to solitary
without any reason given.

He is confined to a very small cell in which one can walk only
three steps, with no windows and only a slot in the metal door
through which food is passed. The bars in front are covered with
a metal mesh screen through which it is almost impossible to
see anything and remain close 24 hours a day.

There is a toilet and a concrete bed with a thin pad in the cell.
His clothes were taken from him and he wears just underpants
and a T-shirt. No shoes.

He cannot tell when it is day or night. The lights in his cell are the
only ones that remain switched on 24 hours a day and the
constant cries of other prisoners, many of whom suffer mental
health problems, prevent him from sleeping.

No reading material or printed material is allowed. Signs are
posted in front of his cell, which states that no one is to have
contact with him. He is the only inmate in this segregation
regime who is not allowed to use the telephone.

Gerardo has unsuccessfully attempted to register a complaint
under the prison's established procedures but has been told
that there are no complaint forms available.

On March 2nd he filed an informal complaint, as the correct form
had not been supplied to him. He hasn't received a response.

On March 11th the prison authorities brought him a letter from
Joaqu�n M�ndez, one of the defense attorneys, but they took it
away before he could read it. On March 14th he was told that he
would be given his legal mail. However, to date he has received
nothing - not even correspondence from his attorneys.

The treatment that is currently being given to Gerardo, Ram�n,
Antonio, Fernando and Ren� is completely illegal and severely
obstructs their defense rights when they and their attorneys need
to prepare the appeal that is to be presented not later than April
7th. This cruel, unusual, discriminatory and completely
unjustifiable treatment constitutes a flagrant case of torture that
has to be strongly and urgently denounced.
________________________________________________________________________

UNITED EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN: This Week

Tuesday, March 18:
Emergency Convergence in New York City
in Union Square at 5 pm

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 19:
No Business as Usual!
No War on Iraq!
NATIONAL CALL TO ACTION

George W. Bush has promised to unleash an all-out war
against Iraq, possibly as soon as Wednesday, March 19. We
join with peace-loving people all over the world in
challenging this 48 hour war ultimatum. At this critical
moment, we urge all people of conscience to oppose this
illegal war of aggression by participating in the
following actions:

1) Tuesday, March 18, 5 p.m. Emergency New York City
convergence at Union Square

2) Wednesday, March 19: Walkout! No Business as Usual!
Converge and demonstrate on the day of the Bush ultimatum.

*New York City, March 19: Converge at 12 noon at Union
Square. March and converge at Times Square at 5 p.m.

*Washington DC, March 19: Converge at 12 noon on the north
side of the White House and stay there all day until a
march at 5 p.m.

*San Francisco, March 19: Gather at 5 p.m. at Powell and
Market

*and at central locations in cities and towns around the
country

3) Saturday, March 22: New York City march, 11:30 a.m.
Assemble at Broadway, between 41st and 36th St.

If war has begun, there will also be a March 22 regional
demo at the White House in Washington DC at 12 noon, San
Francisco, Los Angeles and in other cities around the
country.

If war is launched, no business as usual that day.
Converge at 12 noon and into the night.

We will add additional activities and reports as they come in.

--------------------------------

Initial Endorsers:
A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition
The Greens/Green Party USA
Not In Our Name Project
NYC Forum of Concerned Religious Leaders
New York City Labor Against the War

All other organizations and coalitions are invited to join
this call!

Post ID:3191
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-03-18 11:42:20
Subject:Jericho/Cuban Five/War Protests
Message:

Fifth Anniversary of the Jericho Movement!!

Come celebrate the 5th Anniversary of the founding of the Jericho Movement 
with a rededication and recommitment to the work of freeing our Political 
Prisoners and Prisoners of War!!

MCs-Esperanza Martell, ProLibertad and Lumumba Akinwole-Bandele, Malcolm X 
Grassroots Movement

Program:
Meet the New Jericho Board
Pam Africa
NYC Council Member Charles Baron
Rev. Lucius Walker
Laura Whitehorn

AND MANY MANY MORE...

Also, their will be food, music, performances, videos of Political
Prisoners, Solidarity Statements and MORE...

Friday March 28th, 2003 6pm-10pm
St. Mary's Church W126th St. (between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue)
(Take the 1,9, A, D, C, trains to W125th St.)

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more info. email Jerichonatl@... or call 212-502-1143
http://www.thejerichomovement.com
_______________________________________________________________________

Free the 5 Cuban Political Prisoners!

Come Hear Defense Attorney Len Weinglass
Speak on the Case of the Cuban Five, May 8th


Criminal defense attorney Len Weinglass is currently
representing Cuban Antonio Guerrero in prison in Colorado
convicted of conspiracy along with four fellow Cubans, all
serving long sentences in American prisons. The Cuban Five
attempted to thwart the terrorism of Miami-based Cuban
counter-revolutionaries by documenting their activities and
turning the information over to the U.S. government in the hopes
that our government would stem the violence directed against
Cuba.

The government reciprocated, not by intervening against the
terrorists, but instead arrested the five Cubans on frame-up
charges and convicted them in Miami, where the intimidating
climate made a fair trial impossible. Weinglass has represented
defendants in significant political cases including Tom Hayden,
the Pentagon Papers, the Chicago Seven, Kathy Boudin, and most
recently Mumia Abu Jamal.

Date: Thursday, May 8, 2003
Time: 7:30 pm
Place: The Brecht Forum
122 West 27th Street, 10th floor
Manhattan, New York City

Transportation Information: Take the IRT #1 subway train to 28th
Street or the IND "F" subway train to 23rd Street.

Suggested Donation: $6/$8/$10

For more information please call the Brecht Forum at (212)242-4201.
________________________________________________________________________

March 17, 2003
IMPORTANT: LATEST UPDATE:
From the National Committee to Free the Five Cuban Political
Prisoners in the United States
415-821-6545. fax: 415-821-5782. www.freethefive.org

Dear Friends of the Cuban Five:
A small but very important step toward freeing our five brothers
from the isolation cells they've been locked in, was achieved.
Two days ago, the attorneys' rights to visit their clients was
restored. For the last three weeks, not even the five appeals
lawyers were allowed to see or talk with the five Cuban
anti-terrorist heroes. However, the lawyer-client privilege of
confidentiality is still denied, as monitoring of their conversations
will be instituted.

The cells that Gerardo, Fernando, Rene, Ramon and Antonio
have been imprisoned in are tiny, with lights on 24 hours a day,
no way to know if it is night or day, and no contact with other
people. This is psychological torture and nothing less, meant to
punish the Five Cuban heroes, who have never faltered in their
defense of their country and principles of justice.

Their isolation is keeping them from contacts with their families
and attorneys, and constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.
Unfortunately, many thousands of prisoners in the U.S. are in the
same isolation cells (SHUs) that have been roundly condemned
for their cruelty.

This last week, a mass mobilization was launched through the
Internet, by the Cuban 5 committees in the U.S. and around the
world. Many hundreds of calls and e-mails were made to
Attorney General John Ashcroft and Bureau of Prison director
Kathleen Hawk Sawyer, demanding their release from the "hole."
By all your actions, we let the government know we are vigilant of
the situation and protest every punitive move against the Five
Cuban brothers, and that we will continue to struggle for their
freedom.

Keep the pressure up! Don't stop calling or e-mailing the
Attorney General and the Bureau of Prisons to call for their
immediate release from isolation. Please organize a meeting in
your community on the Five. Check our website:
www.freethefive.org for the available resources and to see how
you can help.

According to Antonio Guerrero's attorney Leonard Weinglass, the
solitary confinement is part of a "special administrative" order,
from the Attorney General to the BOP for implementation. The
order claims that the Five's contacts with other people � by mail
or in person - could result in the unauthorized disclosure of
information that "could pose a threat to the national security of
the United States."

This is a complete fabrication as the Five brothers never had
anything to with information related to U.S. national security, or
classified material. They were protecting Cuba from the Miami
terrorists, unless the U.S. government considers the terrorists
part of their "national security."

The order lasts for one year and can be extended at any time by
Ashcroft.

Severe restrictions on their communication with the outside
world are in effect. Please be very conscious of the difficulties
they face at the moment. Please write to them to give them
encouragement and the warmth of your friendship and solidarity,
although if you see the urgent update about Gerardo Hern�ndez,
he is not getting ANYTHING to read. They may only be able to
respond with a very limited number of letters, because they are
given only a few stamps in the "hole." So far only Fernando
Gonz�lez has been able to write.

We will keep you posted. Please contact us if you have any
questions. Again, thank you all for your great responses. Free
the Five!


From the "Antiterrorism Working Group of the Cuban National
Parliament"
GRAVE VIOLATIONS AGAINST GERARDO HERNANDEZ
We urge all people who read this notice to let all your friends,
families, and colleagues know about it. It is very important.


March 17th, 2003
After frequent requests were made to Assistant United States
Attorney Caroline Heck Miller in Florida, on Sunday, March 16th,
US attorney Leonard Weinglass was able to gain permission to
visit Gerardo Hern�ndez - a visit that already had been planned
back in February before all of the Cuban Five were placed in
solitary confinement.

According to Weinglass, Gerardo is undergoing the most severe
punishment in his prison in Lompoc, California, where he is
confined to what is known as "the Box" within the Special
Housing Unit -a hole within the "Hole". He has been under this
regimen since February 28th when he was transferred to solitary
without any reason given.

He is confined to a very small cell in which one can walk only
three steps, with no windows and only a slot in the metal door
through which food is passed. The bars in front are covered with
a metal mesh screen through which it is almost impossible to
see anything and remain close 24 hours a day.

There is a toilet and a concrete bed with a thin pad in the cell.
His clothes were taken from him and he wears just underpants
and a T-shirt. No shoes.

He cannot tell when it is day or night. The lights in his cell are the
only ones that remain switched on 24 hours a day and the
constant cries of other prisoners, many of whom suffer mental
health problems, prevent him from sleeping.

No reading material or printed material is allowed. Signs are
posted in front of his cell, which states that no one is to have
contact with him. He is the only inmate in this segregation
regime who is not allowed to use the telephone.

Gerardo has unsuccessfully attempted to register a complaint
under the prison's established procedures but has been told
that there are no complaint forms available.

On March 2nd he filed an informal complaint, as the correct form
had not been supplied to him. He hasn't received a response.

On March 11th the prison authorities brought him a letter from
Joaqu�n M�ndez, one of the defense attorneys, but they took it
away before he could read it. On March 14th he was told that he
would be given his legal mail. However, to date he has received
nothing - not even correspondence from his attorneys.

The treatment that is currently being given to Gerardo, Ram�n,
Antonio, Fernando and Ren� is completely illegal and severely
obstructs their defense rights when they and their attorneys need
to prepare the appeal that is to be presented not later than April
7th. This cruel, unusual, discriminatory and completely
unjustifiable treatment constitutes a flagrant case of torture that
has to be strongly and urgently denounced.
________________________________________________________________________

Market

*and at central locations in cities and towns around the

Post ID:3192
Sender:Charlotte Kates <ckates@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-03-19 12:53:10
Subject:PALESTINE AWARENESS WEEK - New Brunswick, NJ - March 23-29
Message:

Sunday, March 23, 2003
Publicity Night!
8:00 PM
Meet at the Rutgers Student Center, 126 College Avenue, New Brunswick, NJ
We will have sidewalk chalk, stickers, flyers, staple guns and all sorts
of grassroots publicity devices available to let the campus know about
PALESTINE AWARENESS! Chalk, flyer, sticker, cross campuses-make the
message visible!

Monday, March 24, 2003
Jenin, Jenin
Film Screening
FIRST TIME IN NEW JERSEY!
7:00 PM
Kreeger Learning Center
151 College Ave.
New Brunswick, NJ
Preceded by a moment of silence to remember Rachel Corrie and the
countless Palestinian martyrs to the struggle for liberation.
"Jenin Jenin" (54 minutes) shows the extent to which the prolonged
oppression and terror has affected the state of mind of the Palestinian
inhabitants of the Jenin refugee camp.
Listen to the old men, the children, the doctors and the grieving mothers
of Jenin, after the Israeli army's April 2002 attack flattened homes and
buried an unknown number of civilians. Bitterness and grief are the
prevailing feelings among the majority of the population. Many have lost
loved ones or are still searching for victims and belongings among the
debris. 'Where is God,' an elderly man desperately wonders when surveying
the debris in the Jenin refugee camp.
A little girl, who does not seem to be much older than twelve, tells her
story but knows no fear. The ongoing violence in her day-to-day life only
nourishes her feelings of hatred and the urge to take revenge. She shouts
that the Palestinians will never give up the struggle, that they will keep
on producing children who can continue the fight against injustice.
The sad question forces itself on the spectator. What will become of a
country, a people when its children are confronted with war and violence
from a very early age?
Banned in Israel, "Jenin Jenin" is dedicated to Iyad Samudi, the producer
of the film, who was shot dead by Israeli soldiers on June 23rd, 2002, as
he returned home after completing the film.

Tuesday, March 25, 2003
Dr. Robert McGowan
Remembering Deir Yassin
7:00 PM
Center for Latino Arts and Culture
122 College Ave.
New Brunseick, NJ
Rutgers-New Brunswick

Daniel A. McGowan is the founder and executive director of Deir Yassin
Remembered, a not-for-profit organization dedicated to the building of a
memorial in Israel to commemorate the loss of Palestinian lives at the
massacre at Deir Yassin in 1948. He is a frequent speaker on issues
involving the Middle East conflict and is an expert in Palestinian
history. He has co-written Remembering Deir Yassin: The Future of Israel
and Palestine and The Saga of Deir Yassin: Myth, Revisionism, and Reality.
McGowan received a B.A. from Cornell University, where he was named Phi
Beta Kappa and was the IIE Scholar at the University of Vienna. He earned
an M.A. at Stanford University, an M.B.A. at Bucknell University, and a
Ph.D. at Pennsylvania State University. He is a professor of economics at
William and Hobart Smith Colleges.

Wednesday, March 26
Teach-OUT on Palestine!
6:00 PM
Brower Commons
College Avenue Campus
New Brunswick, NJ

Noel Winkler, an International Solidarity Movement activist
who traveled to Palestine as part of the ISM's campaign to provide
solidarity, support and protection for the Palestinian people from the
international community, will present his experiences in words and
pictures at this open-air teach-in. Come, watch, discuss!

Performance for Palestine
7:30 PM
Center for Latino Arts and Culture
122 College Ave,
New Brunswick, New Jersey

Join poets, musicians, singers, comedians and more for a night of
performance in solidarity with the Palestinian people! Comedian Maysoon
Zayid, singer Shem Hanafi, poet Nathalie Handal and more will share their
art. An exciting evening of expression!

Thursday, March 27
Jews Against the Occupation Reportback
7:00 PM
Room 113
Livingston Student Center
84 Joyce Kilmer Ave.
Piscataway, NJ
Rutgers-New Brunswick

Four members of the New York-based solidarity group Jews Against the
Occupation will discuss their own experiences visiting Palestine as
International Solidarity Movement activists and their role as Jews in
opposing Israeli aggression against the Palestinian people.
Erica Weitzman travelled to the West Bank this past summer with other JATO
members as part of the International Solidarity Movement's "Freedom
Summer" campaign. Born in Washington, D.C., she has also lived in Boston,
Paris, and Kosovo. She currently lives in New York City.
Ryan Senser traveled to Palestine with other members of JATO in August to
work with Palestinian organizers and other activists from Europe, North
America, and Japan under the auspices of the International Solidarity
Movement. Only a decade ago, he participated in a pro-Zionist tour of
Israel, an experience he has now revisited and rethought extensively. He
is a former College Hillel President and led a delegation of Jewish
college students to Germany as part of a pilot dialogue program in 1995.
He has served as a Hebrew and Religious School teacher in the Jewish
communities in which he has lived.
Born in Jerusalem and the daughter of a rabbi, Ora Wise has worked with
rabbis for human rights with bedouins in West Bank. She co-founded a
Palestine solidarity organization at Ohio State University and helped
organize the Second National Student Conference on the Palestine
Solidarity Movement. She recently particpated in the Palestine Truth Tour
and currently teaches Jewish studies at a synagogue in Brooklyn.
Louisa Solomon participated in the ISM Freedom Summer campaign in August
2002. Alongside Palestinian non-violent organizers, she was injured by the
Israeli army while staging a peaceful demonstration in the Palestinian
town of Huwwara, near Nablus.

Friday, March 28
RESISTANCE!
International Solidarity With Palestine
8:00 PM
Demarest Lounge
College Avenue
New Brunswick, NJ

An evening of speakers, music, poetry and expression in solidarity with
people's liberation movements in Palestine, Colombia, the Philippines,
Nepal and more! Featuring New York-based women of color performance
collective the MAHINA MOVEMENT, Hopeless Dregs of Humanity, acoustic
performers Bryan and Marcy, poet Nijmie Dzurinko and many more will
celebrate people's resistance and artistic expression!

Saturday, March 29
MARCH in New York City for Palestine
11:00 CONVERGE at Times Square
then MARCH to Union Square
Join the NJS contingent! Meet at 9:30 AM at the New Brunswick Train
Station!

Join us in this MASS DEMONSTRATION in solidarity with Palestine in New
York City! Points of unity:

1. Stop the war in Iraq and Palestine - no blood for oil
2. Stop the attack on the pro-Palestinian community in the US -
Arabs, Muslims and Palestinian activists
3. For a free democratic Palestine in all of historic Palestine
4. For Palestinian human rights: the right to return, the right to
resist
5. Stop all US aid to Israel, military, financial, and political

We will have sign and poster making materials available all week at every
event!
Sponsored by: Al-Awda NY/NJ, Arab Muslim American Federation, Beyond
Borders, Defend Palestine Committee, Muslim American Society, Islamic
Centers of New Jersey, Islamic Center of Passaic County, New England
Committee to Defend Palestine, New Jersey Solidarity
Endorsed by: Central NJ Coalition for Peace and Justice, Mumia Abu Jamal
Coalition, International ANSWER Coalition, No Blood for Oil

FREE MUMIA!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign, La Iglesai San Romero De Las Americas, and 
El Partido de Trabajadores Dominicanos invite you to attend a political, 
education and cultural activity in solidarity with Afrian-American Political 
Prisoner Mumia Abu jamal!!

This activity is a part of "FREE MUMIA WEEK" which begins on Friday March 
28th-Saturday April 5th, 2003!!

SPEAKERS:
Rafael Asencio
Radames Perez
Claudia De La Cruz
Franky Velgara

In this activity we will show a Video on Mumia and a Chilean/Mapuche 
cultural performance will be done by Luisa Aracil, of La Pena del Bronx!!

Friday April 4th, 2003 at 6:30pm
2005 Amsterdam Avenue (w159th-w160th St.) 2nd floor

For more information please call: 212-927-9065, 718-601-4751, 201-435-3244 
or email: ProLibertad@...  check out our website at:
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

Post ID:3197
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-03-27 11:38:47
Subject:Support Jericho and Mumia!!
Message:

Fifth Anniversary of the Jericho Movement!!

Come celebrate the 5th Anniversary of the founding of the Jericho Movement 
with a rededication and recommitment to the work of freeing our Political 
Prisoners and Prisoners of War!!

MCs-Esperanza Martell, ProLibertad and Lumumba Akinwole-Bandele, Malcolm X 
Grassroots Movement

Program:
Meet the New Jericho Board
Pam Africa
NYC Council Member Charles Baron
Rev. Lucius Walker
Laura Whitehorn

AND MANY MANY MORE...

Also, their will be food, music, performances, videos of Political
Prisoners, Solidarity Statements and MORE...

Friday March 28th, 2003 6pm-10pm
St. Mary's Church W126th St. (between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue)
(Take the 1,9, A, D, C, trains to W125th St.)

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more info. email Jerichonatl@... or call 212-502-1143
http://www.thejerichomovement.com

FREE MUMIA!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign, La Iglesai San Romero De Las Americas, and 
El Partido de Trabajadores Dominicanos invite you to attend a political, 
education and cultural activity in solidarity with Afrian-American Political 
Prisoner Mumia Abu jamal!!

28th-Saturday April 5th, 2003!!

SPEAKERS:
Rafael Asencio
Radames Perez
Claudia De La Cruz
Franky Velgara

In this activity we will show a Video on Mumia and a Chilean/Mapuche
cultural performance will be done by Luisa Aracil, of La Pena del Bronx!!

Friday April 4th, 2003 at 6:30pm
2005 Amsterdam Avenue (w159th-w160th St.) 2nd floor

Post ID:3199
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-03-28 15:49:55
Subject:X-PRican PP Dr. Jose Solis in NYC!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is excited to announce that Dr. Jose Solis 
Jordan,a former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner that was freed in November 
2002, is coming to New York City!!

Join us on Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building 
Room 714 for a PEOPLE'S RECEPTION FOR DR. JOSE SOLIS JORDAN!!  HELP US 
WELCOME ONE OF OUR FREED BOTHERS/PATRIOTS TO NEW YORK CITY!!

Join us in this rare and unique opprotunity to meet and dialogue with one of 
our freed Puerto Rican Patriots!!

He will be speaking about his experiences behind the walls, HIS WORK IN THE 
ANTI-WAR MOVEMENT IN PUERTO RICO, and hear about his speaking tour
throughout the US and Carribean!!

There will be light refreshments, Dr. Solis Jordan Speaking and a lot of 
community discussion/interaction!!

Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm
Hunter College Room 714
E68th St. and Lexington Avenu
Take the 6 train to E68th St. and Lex. Avenue

For more information please contact: ProLibertad@...

Post ID:3203
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-03-30 15:45:34
Subject:Support the Cuban Five April 7th
Message:

NYC April 7 - Rally To Free The Cuban Five!

Friends,
Please forward this to your lists and spread the word!

If you care about Cuba...
if you care about justice...
if you care about exposing Bush's so-called "War on Terror"...then rally to 
free
the Cuban Five!

MONDAY APRIL 7 @ 12 NOON
RALLY TO FREE THE CUBAN FIVE
MANHATTAN FEDERAL BLDG
26 FEDERAL PLAZA
NEW YORK CITY

Who are the Cuban Five? They are five Cubans who were trying to stop the
ultra-right terrorist groups in Miami from carrying out violent actions 
againstthe people of Cuba.

The Cuban people have been targets of U.S. policy, including a 43-year 
economicblockade designed to punish a whole people who chose a different 
road to build their society. They are victims of terror attacks by the 
Miami-based mafia, many of whom came from the wealthy class that left Cuba 
after the popular overthrow of dictator Fulgencio Batista.

Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n Laba�ino, Ren� Gonz�lez and 
Fernando Gonz�lez, acting in defense of their people, were living in Miami, 
monitoring these terrorist groups to prevent future violence.

But because the U.S. government � through the CIA � has been instrumental in 
funding, training and arming the ultra-right Miami mafia, the FBI targeted 
the five Cubans instead of arresting the terrorists.

This is the only reason that the five Cubans are in prison. They were framed 
up in a political witchhunt and railroaded by the U.S. in a 7-month trial in 
Miami, where it was impossible for them to have a fair trial.

Falsely charged with espionage on the U.S., in reality the five men�s 
mission was to follow the activities of the right-wing. After their arrest 
in September 1998,  they were convicted June 8, 2001 and sentenced December 
2001, from 17 years to life.      ( For a full analysis of the case, see: 
www.freethefive.org/whoare.cfm#analysis0103 )

NEW CRISIS DEVELOPS: In early March, Gerardo, Antonio, Ram�n, Fernando and 
Ren� were suddenly put into solitary confinement in their respective 
prisons, where they still are, suffering severe conditions and denied 
elementary rights. They are prohibited from contact with their families and 
friends, denied reading or writing material, and are greatly restricted from 
attorney visits. We ask people to call Attorney General John Ashcroft at 
202-353-1555 or e-mail: AskDOJ@... and urge their immediate release 
from �the hole.�

An international campaign has been launched to win freedom for the Cuban 
Five. This coming April, their appeals will be filed in the U.S. Court of 
Appeals in Atlanta. Already 17 countries from around the world have pledged 
to make the first week in April a week of international solidarity with the 
five.

Join community activists, religious and labor leaders, and people just like 
you on Monday, April 7th to stand in solidarity with these brave young men.

Sponsored by the NYC Free the Cuban Five Committee. For information call
212.926.5757 or 212.633.6646 or email freethefivenyc@... or check out 
these websites: www.freethefive.org  and www.antiterroristas.cu







_________________________________________________________________
The new MSN 8: smart spam protection and 2 months FREE*  
http://join.msn.com/?page=features/junkmail

Subject:Support the Cuban Five-April 7th
Message:

NYC April 7 - Rally To Free The Cuban Five!

Friends,
Please forward this to your lists and spread the word!

If you care about Cuba...
if you care about justice...
if you care about exposing Bush's so-called "War on Terror"...then rally to 
free
the Cuban Five!

MONDAY APRIL 7 @ 12 NOON
RALLY TO FREE THE CUBAN FIVE
MANHATTAN FEDERAL BLDG
26 FEDERAL PLAZA
NEW YORK CITY

Who are the Cuban Five? They are five Cubans who were trying to stop the
ultra-right terrorist groups in Miami from carrying out violent actions 
againstthe people of Cuba.

The Cuban people have been targets of U.S. policy, including a 43-year 
economicblockade designed to punish a whole people who chose a different 
road to build their society. They are victims of terror attacks by the 
Miami-based mafia, many of whom came from the wealthy class that left Cuba 
after the popular overthrow of dictator Fulgencio Batista.

Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n Laba�ino, Ren� Gonz�lez and 
Fernando Gonz�lez, acting in defense of their people, were living in Miami, 
monitoring these terrorist groups to prevent future violence.

But because the U.S. government � through the CIA � has been instrumental in 
funding, training and arming the ultra-right Miami mafia, the FBI targeted 
the five Cubans instead of arresting the terrorists.

This is the only reason that the five Cubans are in prison. They were framed 
up in a political witchhunt and railroaded by the U.S. in a 7-month trial in 
Miami, where it was impossible for them to have a fair trial.

Falsely charged with espionage on the U.S., in reality the five men�s 
mission was to follow the activities of the right-wing. After their arrest 
in September 1998,  they were convicted June 8, 2001 and sentenced December 
2001, from 17 years to life.      ( For a full analysis of the case, see: 
www.freethefive.org/whoare.cfm#analysis0103 )

NEW CRISIS DEVELOPS: In early March, Gerardo, Antonio, Ram�n, Fernando and 
Ren� were suddenly put into solitary confinement in their respective 
prisons, where they still are, suffering severe conditions and denied 
elementary rights. They are prohibited from contact with their families and 
friends, denied reading or writing material, and are greatly restricted from 
attorney visits. We ask people to call Attorney General John Ashcroft at 
202-353-1555 or e-mail: AskDOJ@... and urge their immediate release 
from �the hole.�

An international campaign has been launched to win freedom for the Cuban 
Five. This coming April, their appeals will be filed in the U.S. Court of 
Appeals in Atlanta. Already 17 countries from around the world have pledged 
to make the first week in April a week of international solidarity with the 
five.

Join community activists, religious and labor leaders, and people just like 
you on Monday, April 7th to stand in solidarity with these brave young men.

212.926.5757 or 212.633.6646 or email freethefivenyc@... or check out 
these websites: www.freethefive.org  and www.antiterroristas.cu

Post ID:3206
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-04-01 22:21:54
Subject:Five Cubans out of the Hole
Message:

La versi�n en Espa�ol sigue a la versi�n en Ingles

STATEMENT BY THE CUBAN NATIONAL ASSEMBLY
April 1st, 2003

As a result of public denunciation and numerous messages of protest,
the Government of Washington decided to put an end to the arbitrary
solitary confinement that it had imposed to Gerardo Hern�ndez, Ren�
Gonz�lez, Ram�n Laba�ino, Antonio Guerrero and Fernando Gonz�lez, and
to place them again in the general penal population, although
maintaining against them several completely discriminatory
restrictions.

It has been demonstrated that during a month, the Government of the
United States violated the rights of the prisoners, of their lawyers
and the norms of due process, seriously damaging the appeal process.
Taking them now out of "the hole",  the U.S. Government is proving
that never existed a "national security" justification  and that it
was obliged to go back because of the denunciations and protests.

The U.S. Government has not finished yet with its arbitrary,
discriminatory and illegal actions. It still maintains inadmissible
prohibitions related to the use of the phone, the correspondence, the
consular access and the family visits, that should be completely
lifted.

It was proved the strength of the international solidarity and its
capacity to act with efficacy, even in very difficult circumstances,
due to the fact that the information about this issue in the big
media was virtually zero.

The Government of the United States in March, 2003 has repeated  the
methods and techniques that  it used before to  prevent a fair trial,
that is precisely the principal question that the Atlanta Appeal
Court should consider.  That is the best proof to demonstrate that
that Court should dismiss the Miami farce and order the release of
the five prisoners.

It is necessary to multiply and intensify the solidarity, now that we
have this additional proof about the serious misconduct of the U.S.
Government.

The solidarity took them out of "the hole".
The solidarity will free them.
The Cuban National Assembly
Havana, April 1st, 2003


DECLARACI�N DE LA ASAMBLEA NACIONAL DEL PODER POPULAR
1 de Abril del 2003

Como resultado de la denuncia p�blica y de numerosos mensajes de
protesta, el gobierno de Washington decidi� poner fin al arbitrario
confinamiento solitario que hab�a impuesto a Gerardo Hern�ndez, Ren�
Gonz�lez, Ram�n Laba�ino, Antonio Guerrero y Fernando Gonz�lez y
ubicarlos otra vez en la poblaci�n penal general aunque a�n mantiene
contra ellos varias restricciones totalmente discriminatorias.

Ha quedado demostrado que el gobierno de Estados Unidos durante un
mes viol� los derechos de los prisioneros, los de sus abogados y las
normas del debido proceso da�ando gravemente el proceso de
apelaci�n.  Al sacarlos del "hueco" ahora el gobierno prueba que no
hab�a ninguna justificaci�n de "seguridad nacional" y que se vi�
obligado a retroceder ante la denuncia y la protesta.

El gobierno no ha terminado a�n con sus acciones arbitrarias,
discriminatorias e ilegales.  Mantiene todav�a prohibiciones
inadmisibles que deben ser eliminadas completamente en cuanto al uso
del tel�fono, la correspondencia, el acceso consular y las visitas
familiares.

Se prob� la fuerza de la solidaridad internacional y su capacidad
para actuar con eficacia incluso en circunstancias muy dif�ciles
sobre todo porque fue escas�sima la informaci�n publicada sobre este
asunto en los grandes medios.

El gobierno de Estados Unidos, en marzo de 2003 ha repetido los
m�todos y t�cnicas que ya emple� antes para hacer imposible un juicio
justo, que es precisamente la cuesti�n fundamental que la Corte de
Apelaciones de Atlanta debe considerar. Esta es la mejor prueba de
que esa Corte deber�a anular la farsa de Miami y disponer la
liberaci�n de los cinco prisioneros.

Es necesario multiplicar e intensificar la solidaridad ahora que
contamos con esta prueba adicional de la conducta dolosa del gobierno
norteamericano.

La solidaridad logr� sacarlos del "hueco"
La solidaridad lograr� liberarlos
Asamblea Nacional del Poder Popular
La Habana, Abril 1ro, 2003

Post ID:3207
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-04-01 22:23:05
Subject:Cuban FIve out of the hole
Message:

La versi�n en Espa�ol sigue a la versi�n en Ingles

STATEMENT BY THE CUBAN NATIONAL ASSEMBLY
April 1st, 2003

As a result of public denunciation and numerous messages of protest,
the Government of Washington decided to put an end to the arbitrary
solitary confinement that it had imposed to Gerardo Hern�ndez, Ren�
Gonz�lez, Ram�n Laba�ino, Antonio Guerrero and Fernando Gonz�lez, and
to place them again in the general penal population, although
maintaining against them several completely discriminatory
restrictions.

It has been demonstrated that during a month, the Government of the
United States violated the rights of the prisoners, of their lawyers
and the norms of due process, seriously damaging the appeal process.
Taking them now out of "the hole",  the U.S. Government is proving
that never existed a "national security" justification  and that it
was obliged to go back because of the denunciations and protests.

The U.S. Government has not finished yet with its arbitrary,
discriminatory and illegal actions. It still maintains inadmissible
prohibitions related to the use of the phone, the correspondence, the
consular access and the family visits, that should be completely
lifted.

It was proved the strength of the international solidarity and its
capacity to act with efficacy, even in very difficult circumstances,
due to the fact that the information about this issue in the big
media was virtually zero.

The Government of the United States in March, 2003 has repeated  the
methods and techniques that  it used before to  prevent a fair trial,
that is precisely the principal question that the Atlanta Appeal
Court should consider.  That is the best proof to demonstrate that
that Court should dismiss the Miami farce and order the release of
the five prisoners.

It is necessary to multiply and intensify the solidarity, now that we
have this additional proof about the serious misconduct of the U.S.
Government.

The solidarity took them out of "the hole".
The solidarity will free them.
The Cuban National Assembly
Havana, April 1st, 2003


DECLARACI�N DE LA ASAMBLEA NACIONAL DEL PODER POPULAR
1 de Abril del 2003

Como resultado de la denuncia p�blica y de numerosos mensajes de
protesta, el gobierno de Washington decidi� poner fin al arbitrario
confinamiento solitario que hab�a impuesto a Gerardo Hern�ndez, Ren�

contra ellos varias restricciones totalmente discriminatorias.

Ha quedado demostrado que el gobierno de Estados Unidos durante un
mes viol� los derechos de los prisioneros, los de sus abogados y las
normas del debido proceso da�ando gravemente el proceso de
apelaci�n.  Al sacarlos del "hueco" ahora el gobierno prueba que no
hab�a ninguna justificaci�n de "seguridad nacional" y que se vi�

El gobierno no ha terminado a�n con sus acciones arbitrarias,
discriminatorias e ilegales.  Mantiene todav�a prohibiciones
inadmisibles que deben ser eliminadas completamente en cuanto al uso
del tel�fono, la correspondencia, el acceso consular y las visitas
familiares.

Se prob� la fuerza de la solidaridad internacional y su capacidad
para actuar con eficacia incluso en circunstancias muy dif�ciles

m�todos y t�cnicas que ya emple� antes para hacer imposible un juicio
justo, que es precisamente la cuesti�n fundamental que la Corte de
Apelaciones de Atlanta debe considerar. Esta es la mejor prueba de
que esa Corte deber�a anular la farsa de Miami y disponer la

Post ID:3208
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-04-03 11:49:08
Subject:Jose Solis Activity/Free Mumia!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is excited to announce that Dr. Jose Solis 
Jordan,a former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner that was freed in November 
2002, is coming to New York City!!

Join us on Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building 
Room 714 for a PEOPLE'S RECEPTION FOR DR. JOSE SOLIS JORDAN!!  HELP US 
WELCOME ONE OF OUR FREED BOTHERS/PATRIOTS TO NEW YORK CITY!!

Join us in this rare and unique opprotunity to meet and dialogue with one of 
our freed Puerto Rican Patriots!!

He will be speaking about his experiences behind the walls, HIS WORK IN THE 
ANTI-WAR MOVEMENT IN PUERTO RICO, and hear about his speaking tour
throughout the US and Carribean!!

There will be light refreshments, Dr. Solis Jordan Speaking and a lot of 
community discussion/interaction!!

Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm
Hunter College Room 714
E68th St. and Lexington Avenu
Take the 6 train to E68th St. and Lex. Avenue

For more information please contact: ProLibertad@...
______________________________________________________________________

LIBERTAD PARA MUMIA!!

La Campa�a ProLibertad, La Iglesia San Romero de Las
Am�ricas y el Partido de Trabajadores Dominicanos te
invitan a asistir a una actividad pol�tica,
educativa y cultural en solidaridad con nuestro
hermano y compa�ero prisionero pol�tico
afro-americano Mumia Abu Jama.

Esta actividad est� organizada como parte de la
semana de "Libertad para Mumia" la cual dar�
comienzo el viernes, 28 de marzo y terminar� el
s�bado, 5 de abril de 2003!!

Oradores/as:

Rafael Asencio
Radam�s P�rez
Claudia De la Cruz
Frank Velgara

Mostraremos un video sobre Mumia y adem�s tendremos
un acto Cultural Mapuche por la compa�era chilena
Luisa Aracil, de La Pe�a del Bronx!!

D�a: Viernes, 4 de abril de 2003
Hora: 6:30pm
Lugar: 2005 Amsterdam Avenue (entre las calles 159th
y 160.), 2nd piso, Manhattan.

Para mas informaci�n pueden llamar a:
(212)-927-9065
(718)-601-4751
(201)-435-3244

Tambi�n pueden escribir electr�nicamente a:
ProLibertad@...
________________________________________________________________________

FREE MUMIA!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign, La Iglesai San Romero De Las Americas, and 
El Partido de Trabajadores Dominicanos invite you to attend a political, 
education and cultural activity in solidarity with Afrian-American Political 
Prisoner Mumia Abu jamal!!

This activity is a part of "FREE MUMIA WEEK" which begins on Friday March 
28th-Saturday April 5th, 2003!!

SPEAKERS:
Rafael Asencio
Radames Perez
Claudia De La Cruz
Franky Velgara

In this activity we will show a Video on Mumia and a Chilean/Mapuche
cultural performance will be done by Luisa Aracil, of La Pena del Bronx!!

Friday April 4th, 2003 at 6:30pm
2005 Amsterdam Avenue (w159th-w160th St.) 2nd floor

For more information please call: 212-927-9065, 718-601-4751, 201-435-3244 
or email: ProLibertad@... check out our website at:
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

http://clinic.mcafee.com/clinic/ibuy/campaign.asp?cid=3963

Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is excited to announce that Dr. Jose Solis 
Jordan,a former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner that was freed in November 
2002, is coming to New York City!!

Join us on Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building 
Room 714 for a PEOPLE'S RECEPTION FOR DR. JOSE SOLIS JORDAN!!  HELP US 
WELCOME ONE OF OUR FREED BOTHERS/PATRIOTS TO NEW YORK CITY!!

Join us in this rare and unique opprotunity to meet and dialogue with one of 
our freed Puerto Rican Patriots!!

He will be speaking about his experiences behind the walls, HIS WORK IN THE 
ANTI-WAR MOVEMENT IN PUERTO RICO, and hear about his speaking tour
throughout the US and Carribean!!

There will be light refreshments, Dr. Solis Jordan Speaking and a lot of 
community discussion/interaction!!

Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm
Hunter College Room 714
E68th St. and Lexington Avenu
Take the 6 train to E68th St. and Lex. Avenue
For more information please contact: ProLibertad@...

many support actions you can take part of:

the effort to build peace in NYC communities:
http://ProLibertadweb.tripod.com/page9.html

visited by his mother:  http://ProLibertadweb.tripod.com/page28.html

http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page16.html

many support actions you can take part of:

Palomas por La PAz y el mundo/Doves for peace in Vieques and the world, join 
the effort to build peace in NYC communities:
http://ProLibertadweb.tripod.com/page9.html

Support Carlos Alberto Torres!!  Help us build pressure so that he can be 
visited by his mother:  http://ProLibertadweb.tripod.com/page28.html

Write to the Vieques Political Prisoners:
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page16.html

Post ID:3218
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-04-10 13:00:02
Subject:Reminder-Jose Solis Activity
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is excited to announce that Dr. Jose Solis 
Jordan,a former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner that was freed in November 
2002, is coming to New York City!!

Join us on Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building 
Room 714 for a PEOPLE'S RECEPTION FOR DR. JOSE SOLIS JORDAN!!  HELP US 
WELCOME ONE OF OUR FREED BOTHERS/PATRIOTS TO NEW YORK CITY!!

Join us in this rare and unique opprotunity to meet and dialogue with one of 
our freed Puerto Rican Patriots!!

He will be speaking about his experiences behind the walls, HIS WORK IN THE 
ANTI-WAR MOVEMENT IN PUERTO RICO, and hear about his speaking tour
throughout the US and Carribean!!

There will be light refreshments, Dr. Solis Jordan Speaking and a lot of 
community discussion/interaction!!

Friday April 11th, 2003 at 6:30pm
Hunter College Room 714
E68th St. and Lexington Avenu
Take the 6 train to E68th St. and Lex. Avenue
For more information please contact: ProLibertad@...
________________________________________________________________________

Check out the ProLibertad website for updates on our campaign work and the 
many support actions you can take part of:

Palomas por La PAz y el mundo/Doves for peace in Vieques and the world, join 
the effort to build peace in NYC communities:
http://ProLibertadweb.tripod.com/page9.html

visited by his mother:  http://ProLibertadweb.tripod.com/page28.html

http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page16.html

Post ID:3220
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-04-13 22:37:35
Subject:Former PRican PP-Antonio Camacho Negron arrested!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is alerting the international community 
about that fact that Antonio Camacho Negron, a former Puerto Rican Political 
Prisoner, was arrested on Sunday afternoon at 2:30pm by Federal Marshalls.

He is being held, incommunicado in Federal Prison in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.  
He was arrested for his alleged violation of Parole; a parole he publically 
denounced and stated he would not recognize due to his political perspective 
on the colonial reality of Puerto Rico and his refusal to recognize US 
hegemony over Puerto Rico.  The parole was also a ridiculous and unjust set 
of rules.

Various Organizations in Puerto Rico are making a call for a support picket 
in front of the Federal Court tomorrow April 14th, 2003 at 12pm.

Please be on the look out for More information.
________________________________________________________________________
from bandera roja http://www.bandera.org

San Juan, Puerto Rico- Alguaciles Federales arrestaron al compa�ero Antonio 
Camacho en la ma�ana de hoy y lo mantienen incomunicado en la C�rcel Federal 
en Guaynabo. Se est� convocando a un piquete en solidaridad con el compa�ero 
a las 12 del mediodia frente al Tribunal Federal donde se celebrar� una 
vista de sentencia en su contra.

A eso de las 2:30 de la tarde dos alguaciles federales se presentaron a la 
casa del hermano del compa�ero con una orden de arresto por alegadamente 
violar las condiciones de su probatoria. Antonio Camacho fu� acusado y 
condenado de transportar 7.5 millones de d�lares en Hartford Connecticut y 
fu� encarcelado en marzo de 1998 a pesar de insistir en que no obedeceria 
las condiciones de su liberaci�n. El compa�ero fu� liberado a principios del 
2002 bajo las mismas condiciones de probatoria.

El compa�ero ha insistido en las vistas de probatoria que no tiene el mas 
minimo inter�s en respetar las injustas condiciones que les est�n 
imponiendo. A pesar de esto los federales insisten en liberar al compa�ero e 
imponerles condiciones sumamente injustas para un prisionero pol�tico como 
reportarse semanalmente ante alguaciles federales, inhibirse de participar 
de actividades pol�ticas y no reunirse con otros compa�eros que han estado 
presos por luchar por la independencia de Puerto Rico. Estas condiciones han 
sido impuestas a otros ex-prisioneros pol�ticos y tienen el objetivo de 
detener la participaci�n de estos en la lucha del pueblo de Puerto Rico.

Convocamos a todos aquellos solidarios con el compa�ero a que se den cita 
frente a la Corte Federal ma�ana lunes 13 de abril de 2003.






_________________________________________________________________

Post Date/Time:2003-04-13 22:38:37
Subject:X-PRican PP-Antonio Camacho Negron ARRESTED
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is alerting the international community 
about that fact that Antonio Camacho Negron, a former Puerto Rican Political 
Prisoner, was arrested on Sunday afternoon at 2:30pm by Federal Marshalls.

He is being held, incommunicado in Federal Prison in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.  
He was arrested for his alleged violation of Parole; a parole he publically 
denounced and stated he would not recognize due to his political perspective 
on the colonial reality of Puerto Rico and his refusal to recognize US 
hegemony over Puerto Rico.  The parole was also a ridiculous and unjust set 
of rules.

Various Organizations in Puerto Rico are making a call for a support picket 
in front of the Federal Court tomorrow April 14th, 2003 at 12pm.

Please be on the look out for More information.
________________________________________________________________________
from bandera roja http://www.bandera.org

San Juan, Puerto Rico- Alguaciles Federales arrestaron al compa�ero Antonio 
Camacho en la ma�ana de hoy y lo mantienen incomunicado en la C�rcel Federal 
en Guaynabo. Se est� convocando a un piquete en solidaridad con el compa�ero

casa del hermano del compa�ero con una orden de arresto por alegadamente 
violar las condiciones de su probatoria. Antonio Camacho fu� acusado y 
condenado de transportar 7.5 millones de d�lares en Hartford Connecticut y 
fu� encarcelado en marzo de 1998 a pesar de insistir en que no obedeceria 
las condiciones de su liberaci�n. El compa�ero fu� liberado a principios del 
2002 bajo las mismas condiciones de probatoria.

El compa�ero ha insistido en las vistas de probatoria que no tiene el mas 
minimo inter�s en respetar las injustas condiciones que les est�n 
imponiendo. A pesar de esto los federales insisten en liberar al compa�ero e 
imponerles condiciones sumamente injustas para un prisionero pol�tico como 
reportarse semanalmente ante alguaciles federales, inhibirse de participar 
de actividades pol�ticas y no reunirse con otros compa�eros que han estado 
presos por luchar por la independencia de Puerto Rico. Estas condiciones han 
sido impuestas a otros ex-prisioneros pol�ticos y tienen el objetivo de 
detener la participaci�n de estos en la lucha del pueblo de Puerto Rico.

Post ID:3222
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-04-21 11:45:18
Subject:Support Antonio Camacho Negron!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is alerting the international community 
about that fact that Antonio Camacho Negron, a former Puerto Rican Political 
Prisoner, was arrested on Sunday April 13th, 2003 by Federal Marshalls.

He is being held in Federal Prison in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico waiting for a 
Parole Hearing. He was arrested for his alleged violation of Parole; a 
parole he publically denounced and stated he would not recognize due to his 
political perspective on the colonial reality of Puerto Rico and his refusal 
to recognize US hegemony over Puerto Rico. The parole was also a ridiculous 
and unjust set of rules.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is asking people to write to Antonio 
Camacho Negron and to let him know that he is in the heart of the people.

Antonio Camacho Negron
#03587-069
MDC Guaynabo
PO Box 2147
San Juan, PR 00922-2147
________________________________________________________________________

Check out the ProLibertad Website:  Http://ProLibertadWeb.Tripod.com for 
several updates and actions for Puerto Rico and the Boricua Political 
Prisoners!!

http://join.msn.com/?page=features/junkmail

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:3224
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-04-23 12:58:55
Subject:ProLibertad Youth/Student Network
Message:

Check out the ProLibertad Student/Youth Network Page:
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

Young people play a pivotal role in the organization and growth of National 
Liberation struggles and the support movements for their Political 
Prisoners!!  It has been the efforts of young people, organizing and 
educating within their schools and communities, that has led to a mass 
popularization of movements and mass consciousness raising about political 
issues that have significant impacts on their communities.

Now more than ever there is an urgent need to organize within the Puerto 
Rican community; the current political climate is both a repressive and 
dangerous one.  There is no way to predict how this climate might effect the 
work to free our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle and 
the many other movements for freedom and peace.

It is time for young people to consolidate their skills and talents to form 
a powerful movement to educate our communities about colonialism, 
militarism, our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, and how repression/this 
upcoming war might effect our communities.

To address this need, ProLibertad is forming a Youth/Student Network to 
create a coalition of individuals and organizations to commit to educating 
and mobilizing for the support of the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the 
Puerto Rican national Liberation struggle, and all other social justice 
movements.  As always, in unity there is strength, strength allows us to 
struggle, and struggle leads to liberation.

ProLibertad is calling all Youth and Young adult Activists to come together 
to form a Network of  Activists that are interested in supporting the Puerto 
Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle, and the movement to free 
Puerto Rico!!

Youth and Young Adults are key in these struggles!!  It is time to UNITE, 
educate, and mobilize!!

If you are interested in working with the Network and helping to put 
together several of our Kick-off events (a few activities and a major 
conference in November 2003), then please contact us at: 
ProLibertad@...

"La Patria es Valor y Sacrifico"
-Don Pedro Albizu Campos





_________________________________________________________________
Help STOP SPAM with the new MSN 8 and get 2 months FREE*  
http://join.msn.com/?page=features/junkmail

Post ID:3226
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-05-01 16:01:29
Subject:Support Vieques!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign congratulates the valiant and powerful 
people of Vieques!!  Today MAy 1st, 2003, the Puerto Rican People have won 
an amzing victory; through mass struggle, building a powerful movement of 
solidarity and international support, the people of Vieques have forced the 
most powerful Navy in the world to cease their military practices!!

The people of Vieques have achieved an amzing victory today,BUT THE MOVEMENT 
IS NOT OVER!!  THE DEMANDS OF THE PEOPLE OF VIEQUES HAVE NOT BEEN MET!!  
Their is still need for de-militarization, devolution, decontamination and 
development!!

AND THERE ARE STILL TWO VIEQUES POLITICAL PRISONERS TO FREE!!

Check out http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com on them and all Boricua Political 
Prisoners!!

________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is alerting the international community 
about that fact that Antonio Camacho Negron, a former Puerto Rican Political 
Prisoner, was arrested on Sunday April 13th, 2003 by Federal Marshalls.

He is being held in Federal Prison in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico waiting for a 
Parole Hearing. He was arrested for his alleged violation of Parole; a 
parole he publically denounced and stated he would not recognize due to his 
political perspective on the colonial reality of Puerto Rico and his refusal 
to recognize US hegemony over Puerto Rico. The parole was also a ridiculous 
and unjust set of rules.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is asking people to write to Antonio
Camacho Negron and to let him know that he is in the heart of the people.

Antonio Camacho Negron
#03587-069
MDC Guaynabo
PO Box 2147
San Juan, PR 00922-2147
________________________________________________________________________

Check out the ProLibertad Website: Http://ProLibertadWeb.Tripod.com for
several updates and actions for Puerto Rico and the Boricua Political
Prisoners!!

Post ID:3228
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-05-02 18:29:05
Subject:US Navy Eviction and Vieques PPs
Message:

Eviction Party

When: Saturday, May 3rd 2003, 10pm - until

Where: 968 Atlantic Avenue, between Grand & Washington

Why: US Navy's Eviction from Vieques!!!!!

Music: Oya Sound Productions: DJ Sabine & DJ Sangoma,
Welfare Poets and other surprise guests
Food/Drink: BYO Goodies

Transportation: A/C train to Clinton/Washington in Brooklyn,
walk one block from Fulton Ave. to Atlantic. Left on Atlantic.

Sparked by www.welfarepoets.com, carried out by welfanos

Phone Basem Aly, 917-440-3112
_______________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is supporting the �Vieques Political 
Prisoner Writing Project� that the Committee for the Rescue and Development 
has created!!

Ismael Guadalupe Torres and Israel Medina Colon are two Vieques Political 
Prisoners incarcerated for their participation in civil disobedience in 
Vieques during the last round of U.S. Navy bombings.

They have been incarcerated for a ridiculously long time and ProLibertad 
supports the Committee�s call for people to begin to write to these two 
brothers.  We ask you to adopt a prisoner and write to them weekly.  Send 
them letters, postcards or greeting cards, and make sure to send them a 
postal money order form time to time for their commissary!!  Let these 
brothers know that they are in the hearts of People!!

Ismael Guadalupe Torres
#21644-069

Israel Medina Colon
#25857-069

MDC Guaynabo
PO Box 2147
San Juan, Puerto Rico
00922-2147

Release Dates for the Vieques Political Prisoners
Israel Medina Colon-May 13th, 2003
Ismael Guadalupe Torres- June 10th, 2003

Post ID:3230

Post Date/Time:2003-05-03 23:25:06
Subject:Vieques News Page
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all supporters to view our 
New Vieques Page on our website.

Franky Velgara, of ProLibertad and The Vieques Support Campaign, has written 
part one of a three part first hand account of his experiences in Vieques on 
the historic May 1st celebration of the US Navy pulling out of Vieques.

Please check out our Vieques News Page:  
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page10.html

and check out the latest news on the Anti-War/Pro-Peace Bulletin; join us on 
Saturday May 10th for a powerful Anti-War Activity in Washington Heights:  
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page30.html

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
