Post ID:3232
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-05-05 13:25:18
Subject:ProLibertad Youth/Student Network
Message:

SAVE THE DATE!! SATURDAY MAY 24TH, 2003 AT 1PM, PLACE TBA
PROLIBERTAD YOUTH/STUDENT NETWORK MEETING
Come disucss the Network and our upcoming Puerto Rico Conference in November 
15th, 2003
_______________________________________________________________________

Young people play a pivotal role in the organization and growth of National 
Liberation struggles and the support movements for their Political 
Prisoners!!  It has been the efforts of young people, organizing and 
educating within their schools and communities, that has led to a mass 
popularization of movements and mass consciousness raising about political 
issues that have significant impacts on their communities.

Now more than ever there is an urgent need to organize within the Puerto 
Rican community; the current political climate is both a repressive and 
dangerous one.  There is no way to predict how this climate might effect the 
work to free our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle and 
the many other movements for freedom and peace.

It is time for young people to consolidate their skills and talents to form 
a powerful movement to educate our communities about colonialism, 
militarism, our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, and how repression/this 
upcoming war might effect our communities.

To address this need, ProLibertad is forming a Youth/Student Network to 
create a coalition of individuals and organizations to commit to educating 
and mobilizing for the support of the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the 
Puerto Rican national Liberation struggle, and all other social justice 
movements.  As always, in unity there is strength, strength allows us to 
struggle, and struggle leads to liberation.

ProLibertad is calling all Youth and Young adult Activists to come together 
to form a Network of  Activists that are interested in supporting the Puerto 
Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle, and the movement to free 
Puerto Rico!!

Youth and Young Adults are key in these struggles!!  It is time to UNITE, 
educate, and mobilize!!

"La Patria es Valor y Sacrifico"
-Don Pedro Albizu Campos










_________________________________________________________________
The new MSN 8: advanced junk mail protection and 2 months FREE*  
http://join.msn.com/?page=features/junkmail

Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is asking folks to visit our website and 
support the many "call-to-actions" that ProLibertad has published on the 
site!!  Now more than ever our Prisoners need our support and commissary 
donations!!

Be sure to check out the follwoing links to specific pages on our website!!

Vieques Political Prisoners:  Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page16.html

Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page30.html

Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page31.html

SAVE THE DATE!!
PROLIBERTAD YOUTH/STUDENT NETWORK MEETING ON SATURDAY MAY 24TH, 2003, 
1PM-3PM, PLACE TO BE ANNOUNCED!!  PLEASE CONTACT ProLibertad@... for 
more information!!

Young people play a pivotal role in the organization and growth of National 
Liberation struggles and the support movements for their Political 
Prisoners!!  It has been the efforts of young people, organizing and 
educating within their schools and communities, that has led to a mass 
popularization of movements and mass consciousness raising about political 
issues that have significant impacts on their communities.

Now more than ever there is an urgent need to organize within the Puerto 
Rican community; the current political climate is both a repressive and 
dangerous one.  There is no way to predict how this climate might effect the 
work to free our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle and 
the many other movements for freedom and peace.

It is time for young people to consolidate their skills and talents to form 
a powerful movement to educate our communities about colonialism, 
militarism, our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, and how repression/this 
upcoming war might effect our communities.

To address this need, ProLibertad is forming a Youth/Student Network to 
create a coalition of individuals and organizations to commit to educating 
and mobilizing for the support of the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the 
Puerto Rican national Liberation struggle, and all other social justice 
movements.  As always, in unity there is strength, strength allows us to 
struggle, and struggle leads to liberation.

ProLibertad is calling all Youth and Young adult Activists to come together 
to form a Network of  Activists that are interested in supporting the Puerto 
Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle, and the movement to free 
Puerto Rico!!

Youth and Young Adults are key in these struggles!!  It is time to UNITE, 
educate, and mobilize!!

�La Patria es Valor y Sacrifico�
-Don Pedro Albizu Campos

Liberation struggles and the support movements for their Political 
Prisoners!!  It has been the efforts of young people, organizing and 
educating within their schools and communities, that has led to a mass 
popularization of movements and mass consciousness raising about political 
issues that have significant impacts on their communities.

Now more than ever there is an urgent need to organize within the Puerto 
Rican community; the current political climate is both a repressive and 
dangerous one.  There is no way to predict how this climate might effect the 
work to free our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle and 
the many other movements for freedom and peace.

It is time for young people to consolidate their skills and talents to form 
a powerful movement to educate our communities about colonialism, 
militarism, our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, and how repression/this 
upcoming war might effect our communities.

To address this need, ProLibertad is forming a Youth/Student Network to 
create a coalition of individuals and organizations to commit to educating 
and mobilizing for the support of the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the 
Puerto Rican national Liberation struggle, and all other social justice 
movements.  As always, in unity there is strength, strength allows us to 
struggle, and struggle leads to liberation.

ProLibertad is calling all Youth and Young adult Activists to come together 
to form a Network of  Activists that are interested in supporting the Puerto 
Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle, and the movement to free 
Puerto Rico!!

Youth and Young Adults are key in these struggles!!  It is time to UNITE, 
educate, and mobilize!!

Post ID:3236
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-05-09 11:56:42
Subject:May 10th-What is next for the Anti-War Movement?
Message:

SATURDAY MAY 10, 2003 @ 3:30p.m.
SPECIAL ANTI-WAR MEETING IN WASHINGTON HEIGHTS
WHAT IS NEXT FOR THE ANTI-WAR MOVEMENT?

2005 Amsterdam Ave. & 159 St. Take 1 or 9 to 157 St.

FEATURED SPEAKERS:
Ramsey Clark on understanding Iraq from a Historical Perspective
Rev. Luis Barrios from San Romero Church and John Jay College
And other invited speakers�

SPECIAL VIDEO PRESENTATION: Latin American Voices Against  U.S. Aggression 
in Iraq, with interviews including Hebe de Bonaffini from Argentina, 
Nicaragua's Daniel Ortega,  Bolivia's Evo Morales, Venezuelan President Hugo 
Chavez and Colombian union leaders.

Sponsored by Dominican Workers Party, Fuerza de la Revolucion, International 
Action Center, NY ANSWER, Unidad del Pueblo and San Romero Church of the 
Americas. To endorse or for more information call: 212.633.6636

Post ID:3237
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-05-12 14:42:40
Subject:New Action Digest
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is asking folks to visit our website and
support the many "call-to-actions" that ProLibertad has published on the
site!!  Now more than ever our Prisoners need our support and commissary
donations!!

Be sure to check out the following links to specific pages on our website!!


Vieques News Update: Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page10.html

Vieques Political Prisoners:  Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page16.html

Write to Antonio Camacho Negron!!:
Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page32.html

Support Carlos Alberto Torres!!:
Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page27.html

ProLibertad Anti-War Bulletin for NYC:
Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page30.html

ProLibertad Youth/Student Network:
Http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com/page31.html
__________________________________________________________________________________

SAVE THE DATE!!

PROLIBERTAD YOUTH/STUDENT NETWORK MEETING ON SATURDAY MAY 24TH, 2003,
1PM-3PM, St. Mary's Church 521 W126th St. between Broadway and MAsterdam 
Avenue (take the 1 or 9 train to w125th St.)  PLEASE CONTACT 
ProLibertad@... for more information!!

Young people play a pivotal role in the organization and growth of National
Liberation struggles and the support movements for their Political
Prisoners!!  It has been the efforts of young people, organizing and
educating within their schools and communities, that has led to a mass
popularization of movements and mass consciousness raising about political
issues that have significant impacts on their communities.

Now more than ever there is an urgent need to organize within the Puerto
Rican community; the current political climate is both a repressive and
dangerous one.  There is no way to predict how this climate might effect the
work to free our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle and
the many other movements for freedom and peace.

It is time for young people to consolidate their skills and talents to form
a powerful movement to educate our communities about colonialism,
militarism, our Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, and how repression/this
upcoming war might effect our communities.

To address this need, ProLibertad is forming a Youth/Student Network to
create a coalition of individuals and organizations to commit to educating
and mobilizing for the support of the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, the
Puerto Rican national Liberation struggle, and all other social justice
movements.  As always, in unity there is strength, strength allows us to
struggle, and struggle leads to liberation.

ProLibertad is calling all Youth and Young adult Activists to come together
to form a Network of  Activists that are interested in supporting the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners, the Vieques struggle, and the movement to free
Puerto Rico!!

Youth and Young Adults are key in these struggles!!  It is time to UNITE,
educate, and mobilize!!

�La Patria es Valor y Sacrifico�
-Don Pedro Albizu Campos

educate, and mobilize!!

Post ID:3239
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-05-14 18:49:06
Subject:ProLibertad Activity Calendars
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging people to open up their calendars 
and plan to attend the following activities!!  Make sure to visit our 
website for any additional information: http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

We ask folks to pay special attention to the Quilombo NYC fund-raiser and 
support that powerful endeavor to organize our youth and empower them!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com
__________________________________________________________________________________

EMERGENCY PROTEST!! NO U.S. WAR ON CUBA! NOW IS THE TIME TO STAND IN 
SOLIDARITY WITH CUBA!!

Cuban Mission to the UN  Corner of 37th Street & Lexington Avenue. New York 
City
SATURDAY, MAY 17, 2003 12 noon - 6 PM

Right-wing opponents of the Cuban Revolution have called for a
demonstration at the Cuban Mission for 1:00 PM Saturday, May 17.
These organizations � part and parcel of a four-decades long
attempt by Washington, DC to destabilize and destroy the Cuban
government and its example of social justice and
internationalism � feel wind in their sails with the stepped-up
provocations by the Bush Administration against the small island
and its mighty international example. In the past weeks we have
seen a highly orchestrated campaign of disinformation and
demonization launched by big-business politicians and their
media. We need money for jobs, schools, hospitals and other
desperately needed programs, NOT war on the Cuban people.

Endorsed by:

Cuba Solidarity New York * Casa De Las Americas * Don Rojas,
WBAI Radio * IFCO/Pastors For Peace * Working Group on P.R.
(Socialist Front) * Comite Dominicano Amigas y Amigas de Cuba *
ProLibertad Freedom Campaign * December 12 Movement * Harlem
Tenants Council *Committee in Solidarity With Venezuela *
Vieques Support Campaign * Saint Mary's Episcopal Church * Black
Solidarity Against The War Coalition * Charles Baron, NY City
Council * Nodutdol � For Korean Community Development * Freedom
Road Socialist Organization * Venceremos Brigade * Rev. P. Luis
Barrios * Unidad Del Pueblo * Partido de Los Trabajadores *
Iglesia de San Romero * Dominican Communist Party * Malcolm X
Grassroots Movement * New Jersey Solidarity * Comite Para la
Justicia en Chile * NISPOP, Network In Solidarity with the
People Of the Philippines * N.Y. Free Mumia Abu-Jamal Coalition
* International Action Center * Joel Schwartz, President CSEA
Local 644 * Workers World Party * International Socialist
Organization (ISO) * Theater of the Oppressed Laboratory

This event will coincide with another protest on the same day at
the Cuba Interest Section in Washington, DC.
__________________________________________________________________________________

Monday May 19, 2003 at 4pm!!
A Day of Recruitment for Justice!!  42nd St. and Broadway Military 
Recruitment Island!!

Join various organizations of color and be a part of Weapons of Mass 
Resistance, Resist War, Occupation and Racism!! MAY 19, 2003 Monday. May 19 
is the birthday of Malcolm X and other freedom fighters. On this day, we 
celebrate Malcolm�s legacy as a war resistor.  In honor of Malcolm, 
communities of color from around the city will come together to participate 
in a �recruitment and registration for justice� at Times Square. For young 
people it�s an alternative to military recruitment. For immigrants, it�s a 
way to resist the racist �Special Registration� of the INS. For all of us, 
it�s a chance to say �no� to war, occupation, and racism.
__________________________________________________________________________________

Sunday, May 25th, 2003 at 12 Noon - 6 PM
Grant�s Tomb 122nd St & Riverside Drive

Initiated by: Latinos Unidos/as Contra La Guerra, Uptown Youth for Peace & 
Justice, Black Radical Congress, Northern Manhattan Neighbors for Peace & 
Justice.  To endorse or pledge donations call: 212-642-1185,
uptownpj@...

A day of Unity in the Community to Bring the Troops Home! Labor Salutes 
Youth!!  Jobs Not War!! End the Poverty Draft!!

Bush has asked Congress for a $75 billion war down payment. In New York, 
Pataki and Bloomberg make this possible by laying off teachers and public 
workers by the thousands. Schools, health and job programs are cut, tuition 
and the transit fare goes up.  Youth deserve education, jobs, recreation and 
healthcare.  Not an early death on a foreign battlefield.  When the troops 
that survive make it back, many will face unemployment, cutbacks and the 
possible destruction of affirmative action; they will face a dramatic 
increase in prison population and the new dangers of the Patriot Act, 
including the suppression of the rights of immigrant families.

Uptown Youth for Peace & Justice and the United New York Black Radical 
Congress call on all young people, workers, teachers and students, union and 
community members, peace-loving families to come out on the International 
Working People�s Holiday, May Day, to celebrate our spirit and future.  This 
will be a festive day. There will be live Hip-Hop, Salsa, Merengue, R&B, 
Folk & Rock music. There will be a Street Fair where community organizations 
and unions can bring their literature and set up tables. There will be 
children�s games and mural painting for families. A day of culture, 
celebration and unity for the cause of  peace and justice.

We call for endorsements and support in building this community festival, 
including financial and in-kind contributions.
__________________________________________________________________________________

SUNDAY MAY 25TH, 2003 2:00-6:00PM
BIRTHDAY BENEFIT FOR VIEQUES!! Celebrating Puerto Rican Activist Genoveva 
Clemente�s 80th Birthday!!  Nuyorican Poet�s Caf� 236 East 3rd Street Bet. 
Aves. B & C

Robin Burdulis, Joe Falcon, Mariposa, Montego Joe, Rubi Theater�s Doo Wop 
Moderno,  Sandra Rodriguez, Paula Zimmerman-Taylor culminating with Grand 
Music Jam (bring your instruments!)

SUGGESTED DONATION:   $20.00 (NO ONE WILL BE TURNED AWAY!!)
For more information (212)868-1478, 212-927-9065 SDiosa@...
__________________________________________________________________________________

Friends & Supporters,

Quilombo NYC will be throwing a dance party to raise funds
for Quilombo Summer 2003 a popular education program for
working class & poor youth of color living in NYC.

Please come through ready to dance and make donations
on Saturday May 31, 2003 at 10 pm in The Brecht Forum
located at 122 West 27th St. on the 10th Floor.

Our mission is to provide opportunities for low-income youth
of color to engage in dialogue and action towards a more
socially just world, and in order to do that we need to
provide youth with the financial resources to choose a
program like Quilombo Summer instead of having to rely
on summer jobs that are disappearing or don't move
young people towards social responsibility.

As we are planning this upcoming summer program news
of the budget cuts and their effects on the youth of
this city during the upcoming months and years has
become more critical.  NYC Summer Youth Employment
Program (SYEP) has been cut from as high as 50,000
jobs a few years ago to 17,000 with the risk of
Gov. Pataki cutting another 12,000 leaving only
5,000 opportunities for our youth this summer.
[see attached article.]

We understand these attacks on vital programs
to be a clear indication of the lack of regard
for the lives of working class & poor people
of color in NYC.  We anticipate an increased
level of targetting by enforcement agencies
as our communities struggle to survive this
period of Bloomberg/Pataki Economics.

How often do jails replace schools
and bars replace books in our society?

Please come out & support us in our efforts to work with youth
to broaden the base of young people working for social justice
in New York City.

OneLove,
Fernando Reals
Quilombo NYC


P.S. To Make Tax-Deductible Contributions Please Send Checks
     Or Money Orders To Quilombo NYC c/o The Brecht Forum
     122 West 27th St. 10th Floor New York, NY 10001
     Please Write 'Quilombo Summer' in the memo/purpose line.
     Thanks In Advance!

www.quilombonyc.org

"when elephants fight,
it is the grass that suffers."
-kikuyu proverb

_________________________________________________________________
MSN 8 helps eliminate e-mail viruses. Get 2 months FREE*.  
http://join.msn.com/?page=features/virus

__________________________________________________________________________________

Monday May 19, 2003 at 4pm!!
A Day of Recruitment for Justice!!  42nd St. and Broadway Military 
Recruitment Island!!

Join various organizations of color and be a part of Weapons of Mass 
Resistance, Resist War, Occupation and Racism!! MAY 19, 2003 Monday. May 19 
is the birthday of Malcolm X and other freedom fighters. On this day, we 
celebrate Malcolm�s legacy as a war resistor.  In honor of Malcolm, 
communities of color from around the city will come together to participate 
in a �recruitment and registration for justice� at Times Square. For young 
people it�s an alternative to military recruitment. For immigrants, it�s a 
way to resist the racist �Special Registration� of the INS. For all of us, 
it�s a chance to say �no� to war, occupation, and racism.
__________________________________________________________________________________

Sunday, May 25th, 2003 at 12 Noon - 6 PM
Grant�s Tomb 122nd St & Riverside Drive

Initiated by: Latinos Unidos/as Contra La Guerra, Uptown Youth for Peace & 
Justice, Black Radical Congress, Northern Manhattan Neighbors for Peace & 
Justice.  To endorse or pledge donations call: 212-642-1185,
uptownpj@...

A day of Unity in the Community to Bring the Troops Home! Labor Salutes 
Youth!!  Jobs Not War!! End the Poverty Draft!!

Bush has asked Congress for a $75 billion war down payment. In New York, 
Pataki and Bloomberg make this possible by laying off teachers and public 
workers by the thousands. Schools, health and job programs are cut, tuition 
and the transit fare goes up.  Youth deserve education, jobs, recreation and 
healthcare.  Not an early death on a foreign battlefield.  When the troops 
that survive make it back, many will face unemployment, cutbacks and the 
possible destruction of affirmative action; they will face a dramatic 
increase in prison population and the new dangers of the Patriot Act, 
including the suppression of the rights of immigrant families.

Uptown Youth for Peace & Justice and the United New York Black Radical 
Congress call on all young people, workers, teachers and students, union and 
community members, peace-loving families to come out on the International 
Working People�s Holiday, May Day, to celebrate our spirit and future.  This 
will be a festive day. There will be live Hip-Hop, Salsa, Merengue, R&B, 
Folk & Rock music. There will be a Street Fair where community organizations 
and unions can bring their literature and set up tables. There will be 
children�s games and mural painting for families. A day of culture, 
celebration and unity for the cause of  peace and justice.

We call for endorsements and support in building this community festival, 
including financial and in-kind contributions.
__________________________________________________________________________________

SUNDAY MAY 25TH, 2003 2:00-6:00PM
BIRTHDAY BENEFIT FOR VIEQUES!! Celebrating Puerto Rican Activist Genoveva 
Clemente�s 80th Birthday!!  Nuyorican Poet�s Caf� 236 East 3rd Street Bet. 
Aves. B & C

Robin Burdulis, Joe Falcon, Mariposa, Montego Joe, Rubi Theater�s Doo Wop 
Moderno,  Sandra Rodriguez, Paula Zimmerman-Taylor culminating with Grand 
Music Jam (bring your instruments!)

SUGGESTED DONATION:   $20.00 (NO ONE WILL BE TURNED AWAY!!)
For more information (212)868-1478, 212-927-9065 SDiosa@...
__________________________________________________________________________________

Friends & Supporters,

Quilombo NYC will be throwing a dance party to raise funds
for Quilombo Summer 2003 a popular education program for
working class & poor youth of color living in NYC.

Please come through ready to dance and make donations
on Saturday May 31, 2003 at 10 pm in The Brecht Forum
located at 122 West 27th St. on the 10th Floor.

Our mission is to provide opportunities for low-income youth
of color to engage in dialogue and action towards a more
socially just world, and in order to do that we need to
provide youth with the financial resources to choose a
program like Quilombo Summer instead of having to rely
on summer jobs that are disappearing or don't move
young people towards social responsibility.

As we are planning this upcoming summer program news
of the budget cuts and their effects on the youth of
this city during the upcoming months and years has
become more critical.  NYC Summer Youth Employment
Program (SYEP) has been cut from as high as 50,000
jobs a few years ago to 17,000 with the risk of
Gov. Pataki cutting another 12,000 leaving only
5,000 opportunities for our youth this summer.
[see attached article.]

We understand these attacks on vital programs
to be a clear indication of the lack of regard
for the lives of working class & poor people
of color in NYC.  We anticipate an increased
level of targetting by enforcement agencies
as our communities struggle to survive this
period of Bloomberg/Pataki Economics.

How often do jails replace schools
and bars replace books in our society?

Please come out & support us in our efforts to work with youth
to broaden the base of young people working for social justice
in New York City.

OneLove,
Fernando Reals
Quilombo NYC


P.S. To Make Tax-Deductible Contributions Please Send Checks
     Or Money Orders To Quilombo NYC c/o The Brecht Forum
     122 West 27th St. 10th Floor New York, NY 10001
     Please Write 'Quilombo Summer' in the memo/purpose line.
     Thanks In Advance!

www.quilombonyc.org

"when elephants fight,
it is the grass that suffers."
-kikuyu proverb

_________________________________________________________________
MSN 8 with e-mail virus protection service: 2 months FREE*  
http://join.msn.com/?page=features/virus

and Younger women to interact with each other.

Post ID:3242
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-05-20 12:49:55
Subject:ProLibertad June Activities
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging people to open up their calendars
and plan to attend the following activities!!  Make sure to visit our
website for any additional information: http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

Please take a look at the Two ProLibertad Activities in June and please
attend!!

We ask folks to pay special attention to the Quilombo NYC fund-raiser and
support that powerful endeavor to organize our youth and empower them,
also!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com
__________________________________________________________________________________

Monday June 9th, 2003 at 6:30pm
Hunter College West Building Room 217 E68th St. and Lexington Avenue
Take the 6 train to E68th St-Hunter College

Suggested Donation-$10 (NO ONE WILL BE TURNED AWAY)

ProLibertad Reception for the UN De-Colonization Committee Puerto Rico
Delegation!!

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

We will be discussing the Vieques Victory, Puerto Rico in the International
Community, the Anti-War work in Puerto Rico, and updates in the Independence
work in Puerto Rico!!

Join us for Discussion, dialogue and find out about what you can do here for
Puerto Rico!!

Reception will have light refreshments!!

Preliminary Reception Panel:
Benjamin Ramos, ProLibertad
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Rubie Alicea, Frente Socialista,
and many other representatives...
_________________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD YOUTH ENCOUNTER 2003
FRIDAY JUNE 27TH, 2003 AT 6:30PM
HUNTER COLLEGE WEST BUILDING ROOM 217
E68TH ST. LEXINGTON AVENUE
TAKE THE 6 TRAIN TO E68TH ST AND HUNTER COLLEGE

Join the ProLibertad Youth/Student Network and The ProLibertad Freedom
Campaign for our 2nd Annual Youth Encounter with former Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner,  Pedro Colon Almenas, and Current Vieques Political
Prisoner, Isamel Guadalupe Torres.

Both Pedro and Ismael are youth activists in Puerto Rico that have been
incarcerated for their political WORK on behalf of Vieques and in the
support of the de-militarization of Vieques/Puerto Rico!!  Pedro was
released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison and
Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on June
10th, 2003.

Come, discuss, and share with these two amazing brothers!!  Join us in this
unique opportunity to dialogue with youth from Puerto Rico that are doing
the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that we are all
doing!!

We will have a light dinner and beverages!!
__________________________________________________________________________________

Sunday, May 25th, 2003 at 12 Noon - 6 PM
Grant�s Tomb 122nd St & Riverside Drive

Initiated by: Latinos Unidos/as Contra La Guerra, Uptown Youth for Peace &
Justice, Black Radical Congress, Northern Manhattan Neighbors for Peace &
Justice.  To endorse or pledge donations call: 212-642-1185,
uptownpj@...

A day of Unity in the Community to Bring the Troops Home! Labor Salutes
Youth!!  Jobs Not War!! End the Poverty Draft!!

Bush has asked Congress for a $75 billion war down payment. In New York,
Pataki and Bloomberg make this possible by laying off teachers and public
workers by the thousands. Schools, health and job programs are cut, tuition
and the transit fare goes up.  Youth deserve education, jobs, recreation and
healthcare.  Not an early death on a foreign battlefield.  When the troops
that survive make it back, many will face unemployment, cutbacks and the
possible destruction of affirmative action; they will face a dramatic
increase in prison population and the new dangers of the Patriot Act,
including the suppression of the rights of immigrant families.

Uptown Youth for Peace & Justice and the United New York Black Radical
Congress call on all young people, workers, teachers and students, union and
community members, peace-loving families to come out on the International
Working People�s Holiday, May Day, to celebrate our spirit and future.  This
will be a festive day. There will be live Hip-Hop, Salsa, Merengue, R&B,
Folk & Rock music. There will be a Street Fair where community organizations
and unions can bring their literature and set up tables. There will be
children�s games and mural painting for families. A day of culture,
celebration and unity for the cause of  peace and justice.

We call for endorsements and support in building this community festival,
including financial and in-kind contributions.

for Quilombo Summer 2003 a popular education program for
working class & poor youth of color living in NYC.

Please come through ready to dance and make donations
on Saturday May 31, 2003 at 10 pm in The Brecht Forum
located at 122 West 27th St. on the 10th Floor.

Our mission is to provide opportunities for low-income youth
of color to engage in dialogue and action towards a more
socially just world, and in order to do that we need to
provide youth with the financial resources to choose a
program like Quilombo Summer instead of having to rely
on summer jobs that are disappearing or don't move
young people towards social responsibility.

As we are planning this upcoming summer program news
of the budget cuts and their effects on the youth of
this city during the upcoming months and years has
become more critical.  NYC Summer Youth Employment
Program (SYEP) has been cut from as high as 50,000
jobs a few years ago to 17,000 with the risk of
Gov. Pataki cutting another 12,000 leaving only
5,000 opportunities for our youth this summer.
[see attached article.]

We understand these attacks on vital programs
to be a clear indication of the lack of regard
for the lives of working class & poor people
of color in NYC.  We anticipate an increased
level of targetting by enforcement agencies
as our communities struggle to survive this
period of Bloomberg/Pataki Economics.

and bars replace books in our society?

to broaden the base of young people working for social justice

we are doing in the City!!

Post Date/Time:2003-05-26 09:28:36
Subject:ProLibertad Youth Encounter
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is seeking endorsers for our June 27th 
Youth Encounter 2003.  Our invited guests are FORMER PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL 
PRISONER Pedro Colon ALmenas and CURRENT VIEQUES POLITICAL PRISONER, WHO 
WILL BE FREED ON JUNE 10TH, Ismael Guadalupe Torres.

Both youth were incarcerated foir thier anti-military work for Vieques, and 
both are active in civil disobedience and peace work in Puerto Rico.

Join us in this unique opprotunity to dialogue with these amazing brothers 
and share your own experiences, ENDORSE THIS ACTIVITY!!

We ask folks to pay special attention to the Quilombo NYC fund-raiser and
support that powerful endeavor to organize our youth and empower them,
also!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...

Friends & Supporters,

Quilombo NYC will be throwing a dance party to raise funds
for Quilombo Summer 2003 a popular education program for
working class & poor youth of color living in NYC.

Please come through ready to dance and make donations
on Saturday May 31, 2003 at 10 pm in The Brecht Forum
located at 122 West 27th St. on the 10th Floor.

Our mission is to provide opportunities for low-income youth
of color to engage in dialogue and action towards a more
socially just world, and in order to do that we need to
provide youth with the financial resources to choose a
program like Quilombo Summer instead of having to rely
on summer jobs that are disappearing or don't move
young people towards social responsibility.

As we are planning this upcoming summer program news
of the budget cuts and their effects on the youth of
this city during the upcoming months and years has
become more critical.  NYC Summer Youth Employment
Program (SYEP) has been cut from as high as 50,000
jobs a few years ago to 17,000 with the risk of
Gov. Pataki cutting another 12,000 leaving only
5,000 opportunities for our youth this summer.
[see attached article.]

We understand these attacks on vital programs
to be a clear indication of the lack of regard
for the lives of working class & poor people
of color in NYC.  We anticipate an increased
level of targetting by enforcement agencies
as our communities struggle to survive this
period of Bloomberg/Pataki Economics.

How often do jails replace schools
and bars replace books in our society?

Please come out & support us in our efforts to work with youth
to broaden the base of young people working for social justice
in New York City.

OneLove,
Fernando Reals
Quilombo NYC


P.S. To Make Tax-Deductible Contributions Please Send Checks
     Or Money Orders To Quilombo NYC c/o The Brecht Forum
     122 West 27th St. 10th Floor New York, NY 10001
     Please Write 'Quilombo Summer' in the memo/purpose line.
     Thanks In Advance!

www.quilombonyc.org

it is the grass that suffers."

Friends & Supporters,

Quilombo NYC will be throwing a dance party to raise funds
for Quilombo Summer 2003 a popular education program for
working class & poor youth of color living in NYC.

Please come through ready to dance and make donations
on Saturday May 31, 2003 at 10 pm in The Brecht Forum
located at 122 West 27th St. on the 10th Floor.

Our mission is to provide opportunities for low-income youth
of color to engage in dialogue and action towards a more
socially just world, and in order to do that we need to
provide youth with the financial resources to choose a
program like Quilombo Summer instead of having to rely
on summer jobs that are disappearing or don't move
young people towards social responsibility.

As we are planning this upcoming summer program news
of the budget cuts and their effects on the youth of
this city during the upcoming months and years has
become more critical.  NYC Summer Youth Employment
Program (SYEP) has been cut from as high as 50,000
jobs a few years ago to 17,000 with the risk of
Gov. Pataki cutting another 12,000 leaving only
5,000 opportunities for our youth this summer.
[see attached article.]

We understand these attacks on vital programs
to be a clear indication of the lack of regard
for the lives of working class & poor people
of color in NYC.  We anticipate an increased
level of targetting by enforcement agencies
as our communities struggle to survive this
period of Bloomberg/Pataki Economics.

How often do jails replace schools
and bars replace books in our society?

Please come out & support us in our efforts to work with youth
to broaden the base of young people working for social justice
in New York City.

OneLove,
Fernando Reals
Quilombo NYC


P.S. To Make Tax-Deductible Contributions Please Send Checks
     Or Money Orders To Quilombo NYC c/o The Brecht Forum
     122 West 27th St. 10th Floor New York, NY 10001
     Please Write 'Quilombo Summer' in the memo/purpose line.
     Thanks In Advance!

www.quilombonyc.org

"when elephants fight,
it is the grass that suffers."
-kikuyu proverb

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging people to open up their calendars
and plan to attend the following activities!!  Make sure to visit our
website for any additional information: http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

Please take a look at the Two ProLibertad Activities in June and please
attend!!

We ask folks to pay special attention to the Quilombo NYC fund-raiser and
support that powerful endeavor to organize our youth and empower them,
also!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com
__________________________________________________________________________________

Monday June 9th, 2003 at 6:30pm
Hunter College West Building Room 217 E68th St. and Lexington Avenue
Take the 6 train to E68th St-Hunter College

Suggested Donation-$10 (NO ONE WILL BE TURNED AWAY)

ProLibertad Reception for the UN De-Colonization Committee Puerto Rico
Delegation!!

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

We will be discussing the Vieques Victory, Puerto Rico in the International
Community, the Anti-War work in Puerto Rico, and updates in the Independence
work in Puerto Rico!!

Join us for Discussion, dialogue and find out about what you can do here for
Puerto Rico!!

Reception will have light refreshments!!

Benjamin Ramos, ProLibertad
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista

and representatives of the PIP, El Nuevo Movimiento, EL Partido

PROLIBERTAD YOUTH ENCOUNTER 2003
FRIDAY JUNE 27TH, 2003 AT 6:30PM
HUNTER COLLEGE WEST BUILDING ROOM 217
E68TH ST. LEXINGTON AVENUE
TAKE THE 6 TRAIN TO E68TH ST AND HUNTER COLLEGE

Join the ProLibertad Youth/Student Network and The ProLibertad Freedom
Campaign for our 2nd Annual Youth Encounter with former Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner,  Pedro Colon Almenas, and Current Vieques Political
Prisoner, Isamel Guadalupe Torres.

Both Pedro and Ismael are youth activists in Puerto Rico that have been
incarcerated for their political WORK on behalf of Vieques and in the
support of the de-militarization of Vieques/Puerto Rico!!  Pedro was
released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison and
Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on June
10th, 2003.

Come, discuss, and share with these two amazing brothers!!  Join us in this
unique opportunity to dialogue with youth from Puerto Rico that are doing
the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that we are all
doing!!

We will have a light dinner and beverages!!

Endorsed by:
Network in Solidarity with the People of the Philippines (NISPOP)
DRUM-Desis Rising Up & Moving
YouthPower & Desi Reel Newz
Malcolm X Grassroots Movement
QUILOMBO NYC
Committee for Social Justice in Colombia
Bronx Pryde
El Partido de los Trabajadores Dominicanos
The Code

__________________________________________________________________________________

Friends & Supporters,

Quilombo NYC will be throwing a dance party to raise funds
for Quilombo Summer 2003 a popular education program for
working class & poor youth of color living in NYC.

Please come through ready to dance and make donations
on Saturday May 31, 2003 at 10 pm in The Brecht Forum
located at 122 West 27th St. on the 10th Floor.

Our mission is to provide opportunities for low-income youth
of color to engage in dialogue and action towards a more
socially just world, and in order to do that we need to
provide youth with the financial resources to choose a
program like Quilombo Summer instead of having to rely
on summer jobs that are disappearing or don't move
young people towards social responsibility.

As we are planning this upcoming summer program news
of the budget cuts and their effects on the youth of
this city during the upcoming months and years has
become more critical.  NYC Summer Youth Employment
Program (SYEP) has been cut from as high as 50,000
jobs a few years ago to 17,000 with the risk of
Gov. Pataki cutting another 12,000 leaving only
5,000 opportunities for our youth this summer.
[see attached article.]

We understand these attacks on vital programs
to be a clear indication of the lack of regard
for the lives of working class & poor people
of color in NYC.  We anticipate an increased
level of targetting by enforcement agencies
as our communities struggle to survive this
period of Bloomberg/Pataki Economics.

How often do jails replace schools
and bars replace books in our society?

Please come out & support us in our efforts to work with youth
to broaden the base of young people working for social justice
in New York City.

OneLove,
Fernando Reals
Quilombo NYC


P.S. To Make Tax-Deductible Contributions Please Send Checks
     Or Money Orders To Quilombo NYC c/o The Brecht Forum
     122 West 27th St. 10th Floor New York, NY 10001
     Please Write 'Quilombo Summer' in the memo/purpose line.
     Thanks In Advance!

www.quilombonyc.org

"when elephants fight,
it is the grass that suffers."
-kikuyu proverb

Prisoner, Isamel Guadalupe Torres.

Both Pedro and Ismael are youth activists in Puerto Rico that have been
incarcerated for their political WORK on behalf of Vieques and in the
support of the de-militarization of Vieques/Puerto Rico!!  Pedro was
released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison and
Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on June
10th, 2003.

the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that we are all

Friends & Supporters,

Quilombo NYC will be throwing a dance party to raise funds
for Quilombo Summer 2003 a popular education program for
working class & poor youth of color living in NYC.

Please come through ready to dance and make donations
on Saturday May 31, 2003 at 10 pm in The Brecht Forum
located at 122 West 27th St. on the 10th Floor.

Our mission is to provide opportunities for low-income youth
of color to engage in dialogue and action towards a more
socially just world, and in order to do that we need to
provide youth with the financial resources to choose a
program like Quilombo Summer instead of having to rely
on summer jobs that are disappearing or don't move
young people towards social responsibility.

As we are planning this upcoming summer program news
of the budget cuts and their effects on the youth of
this city during the upcoming months and years has
become more critical.  NYC Summer Youth Employment
Program (SYEP) has been cut from as high as 50,000
jobs a few years ago to 17,000 with the risk of
Gov. Pataki cutting another 12,000 leaving only
5,000 opportunities for our youth this summer.
[see attached article.]

We understand these attacks on vital programs
to be a clear indication of the lack of regard
for the lives of working class & poor people
of color in NYC.  We anticipate an increased
level of targetting by enforcement agencies
as our communities struggle to survive this
period of Bloomberg/Pataki Economics.

How often do jails replace schools
and bars replace books in our society?

Please come out & support us in our efforts to work with youth
to broaden the base of young people working for social justice
in New York City.

Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging people to open up their calendars
and plan to attend the following activities!!  Make sure to visit our

Prisoner Ismael Guadalupe Torres and how he is being mistreated in MDC

The Code


Vieques civil disobedient Ismael Guadalupe Torres is placed in the hole

San Juan, 2 June (EFE).-

All Puerto Rico with Vieques Committee denounced today that the US 
authorities in the US
Federal Jail in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico have placed college student Ismael 
Guadalupe Torres in the hole.  Guadalupe Torres is jailed because he is a 
civil disobedient that trespassed into  Navy restricted land in Vieques, 
Puerto Rico

Jos� Che Paralitici and Josefina Pantojas, spokespersons for the Committee, 
denounced that on Friday prison officials told Guadalupe Torres that they 
knew that he was trying to enter a cell phone into the prison.  Paralitici 
and Pantojas said that Guadalupe Torres called his father Ismael Guadalupe 
Ortiz and told him what had happened. A little while later prison officials 
removed Ismael from his cell and placed him in the hole. Sunday when his 
mother Norma Torres went to visit him accompanied by his fiance and his 
brother they observed Ismael in the orange uniform utilized by those who are 
placed in the hole.

"We know that he is in the hole with two other persons.  That he is locked 
up for 23 hours  and that he is sleeping on the floor.  He does not have 
access to phone calls and he is at the mercy of the prison guards," 
denounced Paralitici and Pantoja is a written press release.  "We hold the 
prison officials responsible for his custody accountable for what might 
occur to Ismael Guadalupe Torres."  Guadalupe Torres was condemned to a 140 
day sentence for trespassing on the lands that the US Navy used for their 
maneuvers.

As a demonstration of its solidarity The All Puerto Rico with Vieques 
Committee will hold a picket tomorrow June 3, 2003, at 5:00 PM in front of 
the US Federal Jail in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.

Brothers and Sisters:

As you all know, the last civil disobedient that was arrested during the 
last bombing practices in Vieques, Ismael Guadalupe Torres, remains in the 
Federal Prison in Puerto Rico.  Ismael who is a member of the Vieques youth 
organization Vieques Youth United (JUVU-Juventud Viequense Unida) has been 
arrested 3 times and they are keeping him prisoner at this federal prison.

In the last couple of days Maelito has been subjected to the rage of some of 
his jailers.  First when the May 1st incidents occurred with the burning of 
the trucks and the use of sledgehammers, one of the prison guards blatantly 
provoked him leading to a strong exchange and debate.  Following this 
situation Maelito communicates with me indicating that he is being accused 
of having a phone conversation with his girfriend where they supposedly 
spoke about smuggling him a telephone into the prison.  After he spoke with 
me they put him the hole.  This happened immediately after he spoke with me. 
  Another inmate that shares the cell with Maelito was also taken to the 
hole and accused of being an accomplice.

Since this past Friday night he has been sleeping on the floor.  He is not 
being given his mail.  Many of his letters have been returned to the 
senders.  His telephone calls have been restricted to one phone call which 
he can make Thursday of this week.  They have also eliminated visists from 
his family.  We will not be able to see him.  It is obvious that what they 
want to do is to isolate him and to prevent any communication with us.

As we all know, many of these Federal employees are sympathetic to the most 
right-wing sectors in Puerto Rico.  Many have gotten their jobs as jailers, 
prison guards, as a result of the interevention and influence of a 
politician in the right-wing of the New Progressive Party (PNP).  This 
accounts for the cruel and inhuman treatment by some of the prison guards 
against those of us who have been jailed for civil disobedience.

We are making a call to everyone to send letters to Ismaelito at the prison. 
  They open all his letters and in this way the prison guards will read 
them.  While preparations for his release on Tuesday, June 10th continue, on 
Monday, June 9th, there will be vigil at the camps set up by the Federal 
Prison.  Some of us will remain there overnight to recieve and welcome the 
last civil disobedient in the morning.

You can write to Ismaelito at the following address:

Ismael Guadalupe Torres
21644-069
MDC  Guaynabo
P.O. BOX  2147
S.J., PUerto Rico 00922-2147

In solidarity,
The Guadalupe Torres Family

_________________________________________________________________
MSN 8 helps eliminate e-mail viruses. Get 2 months FREE*.  
http://join.msn.com/?page=features/virus

the US Federal Jail in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.

Brothers and Sisters:

As you all know, the last civil disobedient that was arrested during the
last bombing practices in Vieques, Ismael Guadalupe Torres, remains in the
Federal Prison in Puerto Rico.  Ismael who is a member of the Vieques youth
organization Vieques Youth United (JUVU-Juventud Viequense Unida) has been
arrested 3 times and they are keeping him prisoner at this federal prison.

In the last couple of days Maelito has been subjected to the rage of some of
his jailers.  First when the May 1st incidents occurred with the burning of
the trucks and the use of sledgehammers, one of the prison guards blatantly
provoked him leading to a strong exchange and debate.  Following this
situation Maelito communicates with me indicating that he is being accused
of having a phone conversation with his girfriend where they supposedly
spoke about smuggling him a telephone into the prison.  After he spoke with
me they put him the hole.  This happened immediately after he spoke with me.
  Another inmate that shares the cell with Maelito was also taken to the
hole and accused of being an accomplice.

Since this past Friday night he has been sleeping on the floor.  He is not
being given his mail.  Many of his letters have been returned to the
senders.  His telephone calls have been restricted to one phone call which
he can make Thursday of this week.  They have also eliminated visists from
his family.  We will not be able to see him.  It is obvious that what they
want to do is to isolate him and to prevent any communication with us.

As we all know, many of these Federal employees are sympathetic to the most
right-wing sectors in Puerto Rico.  Many have gotten their jobs as jailers,
prison guards, as a result of the interevention and influence of a
politician in the right-wing of the New Progressive Party (PNP).  This
accounts for the cruel and inhuman treatment by some of the prison guards
against those of us who have been jailed for civil disobedience.

We are making a call to everyone to send letters to Ismaelito at the prison.
  They open all his letters and in this way the prison guards will read
them.  While preparations for his release on Tuesday, June 10th continue, on
Monday, June 9th, there will be vigil at the camps set up by the Federal
Prison.  Some of us will remain there overnight to recieve and welcome the
last civil disobedient in the morning.

You can write to Ismaelito at the following address:

Ismael Guadalupe Torres
21644-069
MDC  Guaynabo
P.O. BOX  2147
S.J., PUerto Rico 00922-2147

In solidarity,
The Guadalupe Torres Family

_________________________________________________________________
Add photos to your messages with MSN 8. Get 2 months FREE*.  
http://join.msn.com/?page=features/featuredemail

Post ID:3253
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2003-06-04 09:50:44
Subject:Vieques PP needs support!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging people to open up their calendars
and plan to attend the following activities!!  Make sure to visit our
website for any additional information: http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

PLease scroll down the message for a serious update on Vieques Political
Prisoner Ismael Guadalupe Torres and how he is being mistreated in MDC
Guaynabo.  PLease read the update and remember to write to Ismael at MDC
Guaynabo!!  ALSO REMEMBER, ISAMEL WILL BE IN NYC ON FRIDAY JUNE 27TH FOR OUR
ANNUAL YOUTH ENCOUNTER!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com
__________________________________________________________________________________

Monday June 9th, 2003 at 6:30pm
Hunter College West Building Room 217 E68th St. and Lexington Avenue
Take the 6 train to E68th St-Hunter College

Suggested Donation-$10 (NO ONE WILL BE TURNED AWAY)

ProLibertad Reception for the UN De-Colonization Committee Puerto Rico
Delegation!!

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

We will be discussing the Vieques Victory, Puerto Rico in the International
Community, the Anti-War work in Puerto Rico, and updates in the Independence
work in Puerto Rico!!

Join us for Discussion, dialogue and find out about what you can do here for
Puerto Rico!!

Reception will have light refreshments!!

Benjamin Ramos, ProLibertad
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Elizabeth Santiago, Frente Socialista,

and representatives of the PIP, El Nuevo Movimiento, EL Partido
NAcionalist...
_________________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD YOUTH ENCOUNTER 2003
FRIDAY JUNE 27TH, 2003 AT 6:30PM
HUNTER COLLEGE WEST BUILDING ROOM 217
E68TH ST. LEXINGTON AVENUE
TAKE THE 6 TRAIN TO E68TH ST AND HUNTER COLLEGE

Join the ProLibertad Youth/Student Network and The ProLibertad Freedom
Campaign for our 2nd Annual Youth Encounter with former Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner,  Pedro Colon Almenas, and Current Vieques Political
Prisoner, Isamel Guadalupe Torres.

Both Pedro and Ismael are youth activists in Puerto Rico that have been
incarcerated for their political WORK on behalf of Vieques and in the
support of the de-militarization of Vieques/Puerto Rico!!  Pedro was
released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison and
Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on June
10th, 2003.

Come, discuss, and share with these two amazing brothers!!  Join us in this
unique opportunity to dialogue with youth from Puerto Rico that are doing
the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that we are all
doing!!

We will have a light dinner and beverages!!

Endorsed by:
Network in Solidarity with the People of the Philippines (NISPOP)
DRUM-Desis Rising Up & Moving
YouthPower & Desi Reel Newz
Malcolm X Grassroots Movement
QUILOMBO NYC
Committee for Social Justice in Colombia
Bronx Pryde
El Partido de los Trabajadores Dominicanos
The Code


Vieques civil disobedient Ismael Guadalupe Torres is placed in the hole

San Juan, 2 June (EFE).-

All Puerto Rico with Vieques Committee denounced today that the US
authorities in the US
Federal Jail in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico have placed college student Ismael
Guadalupe Torres in the hole.  Guadalupe Torres is jailed because he is a
civil disobedient that trespassed into  Navy restricted land in Vieques,
Puerto Rico

Jos� Che Paralitici and Josefina Pantojas, spokespersons for the Committee,
denounced that on Friday prison officials told Guadalupe Torres that they
knew that he was trying to enter a cell phone into the prison.  Paralitici
and Pantojas said that Guadalupe Torres called his father Ismael Guadalupe
Ortiz and told him what had happened. A little while later prison officials
removed Ismael from his cell and placed him in the hole. Sunday when his
mother Norma Torres went to visit him accompanied by his fiance and his
brother they observed Ismael in the orange uniform utilized by those who are
placed in the hole.

"We know that he is in the hole with two other persons.  That he is locked
up for 23 hours  and that he is sleeping on the floor.  He does not have
access to phone calls and he is at the mercy of the prison guards,"
denounced Paralitici and Pantoja is a written press release.  "We hold the
prison officials responsible for his custody accountable for what might
occur to Ismael Guadalupe Torres."  Guadalupe Torres was condemned to a 140
day sentence for trespassing on the lands that the US Navy used for their
maneuvers.

As a demonstration of its solidarity The All Puerto Rico with Vieques
Committee will hold a picket tomorrow June 3, 2003, at 5:00 PM in front of
the US Federal Jail in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.

Brothers and Sisters:

As you all know, the last civil disobedient that was arrested during the
last bombing practices in Vieques, Ismael Guadalupe Torres, remains in the
Federal Prison in Puerto Rico.  Ismael who is a member of the Vieques youth
organization Vieques Youth United (JUVU-Juventud Viequense Unida) has been
arrested 3 times and they are keeping him prisoner at this federal prison.

In the last couple of days Maelito has been subjected to the rage of some of
his jailers.  First when the May 1st incidents occurred with the burning of
the trucks and the use of sledgehammers, one of the prison guards blatantly
provoked him leading to a strong exchange and debate.  Following this
situation Maelito communicates with me indicating that he is being accused
of having a phone conversation with his girfriend where they supposedly
spoke about smuggling him a telephone into the prison.  After he spoke with
me they put him the hole.  This happened immediately after he spoke with me.
  Another inmate that shares the cell with Maelito was also taken to the
hole and accused of being an accomplice.

Since this past Friday night he has been sleeping on the floor.  He is not
being given his mail.  Many of his letters have been returned to the
senders.  His telephone calls have been restricted to one phone call which
he can make Thursday of this week.  They have also eliminated visists from
his family.  We will not be able to see him.  It is obvious that what they
want to do is to isolate him and to prevent any communication with us.

As we all know, many of these Federal employees are sympathetic to the most
right-wing sectors in Puerto Rico.  Many have gotten their jobs as jailers,
prison guards, as a result of the interevention and influence of a
politician in the right-wing of the New Progressive Party (PNP).  This
accounts for the cruel and inhuman treatment by some of the prison guards
against those of us who have been jailed for civil disobedience.

We are making a call to everyone to send letters to Ismaelito at the prison.
  They open all his letters and in this way the prison guards will read
them.  While preparations for his release on Tuesday, June 10th continue, on
Monday, June 9th, there will be vigil at the camps set up by the Federal
Prison.  Some of us will remain there overnight to recieve and welcome the
last civil disobedient in the morning.

You can write to Ismaelito at the following address:

Ismael Guadalupe Torres
21644-069
MDC  Guaynabo
P.O. BOX  2147
S.J., PUerto Rico 00922-2147

In solidarity,
The Guadalupe Torres Family

_________________________________________________________________

http://join.msn.com/?page=features/junkmail

Vieques civil disobedient Ismael Guadalupe Torres is placed in the hole

San Juan, 2 June (EFE).-

All Puerto Rico with Vieques Committee denounced today that the US
authorities in the US
Federal Jail in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico have placed college student Ismael
Guadalupe Torres in the hole.  Guadalupe Torres is jailed because he is a
civil disobedient that trespassed into  Navy restricted land in Vieques,
Puerto Rico

Jos� Che Paralitici and Josefina Pantojas, spokespersons for the Committee,
denounced that on Friday prison officials told Guadalupe Torres that they
knew that he was trying to enter a cell phone into the prison.  Paralitici
and Pantojas said that Guadalupe Torres called his father Ismael Guadalupe
Ortiz and told him what had happened. A little while later prison officials
removed Ismael from his cell and placed him in the hole. Sunday when his
mother Norma Torres went to visit him accompanied by his fiance and his
brother they observed Ismael in the orange uniform utilized by those who are
placed in the hole.

"We know that he is in the hole with two other persons.  That he is locked
up for 23 hours  and that he is sleeping on the floor.  He does not have
access to phone calls and he is at the mercy of the prison guards,"
denounced Paralitici and Pantoja is a written press release.  "We hold the
prison officials responsible for his custody accountable for what might
occur to Ismael Guadalupe Torres."  Guadalupe Torres was condemned to a 140
day sentence for trespassing on the lands that the US Navy used for their
maneuvers.

As a demonstration of its solidarity The All Puerto Rico with Vieques
Committee will hold a picket tomorrow June 3, 2003, at 5:00 PM in front of
the US Federal Jail in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.

Brothers and Sisters:

As you all know, the last civil disobedient that was arrested during the
last bombing practices in Vieques, Ismael Guadalupe Torres, remains in the
Federal Prison in Puerto Rico.  Ismael who is a member of the Vieques youth
organization Vieques Youth United (JUVU-Juventud Viequense Unida) has been
arrested 3 times and they are keeping him prisoner at this federal prison.

In the last couple of days Maelito has been subjected to the rage of some of
his jailers.  First when the May 1st incidents occurred with the burning of
the trucks and the use of sledgehammers, one of the prison guards blatantly
provoked him leading to a strong exchange and debate.  Following this
situation Maelito communicates with me indicating that he is being accused
of having a phone conversation with his girfriend where they supposedly
spoke about smuggling him a telephone into the prison.  After he spoke with
me they put him the hole.  This happened immediately after he spoke with me.
  Another inmate that shares the cell with Maelito was also taken to the
hole and accused of being an accomplice.

Since this past Friday night he has been sleeping on the floor.  He is not
being given his mail.  Many of his letters have been returned to the
senders.  His telephone calls have been restricted to one phone call which
he can make Thursday of this week.  They have also eliminated visists from
his family.  We will not be able to see him.  It is obvious that what they
want to do is to isolate him and to prevent any communication with us.

As we all know, many of these Federal employees are sympathetic to the most
right-wing sectors in Puerto Rico.  Many have gotten their jobs as jailers,
prison guards, as a result of the interevention and influence of a
politician in the right-wing of the New Progressive Party (PNP).  This
accounts for the cruel and inhuman treatment by some of the prison guards
against those of us who have been jailed for civil disobedience.

We are making a call to everyone to send letters to Ismaelito at the prison.
  They open all his letters and in this way the prison guards will read
them.  While preparations for his release on Tuesday, June 10th continue, on
Monday, June 9th, there will be vigil at the camps set up by the Federal
Prison.  Some of us will remain there overnight to recieve and welcome the
last civil disobedient in the morning.

You can write to Ismaelito at the following address:

Ismael Guadalupe Torres
21644-069
MDC  Guaynabo
P.O. BOX  2147
S.J., PUerto Rico 00922-2147

In solidarity,
The Guadalupe Torres Family

knew that he was trying to enter a cell phone into the prison.  Paralitici
and Pantojas said that Guadalupe Torres called his father Ismael Guadalupe
Ortiz and told him what had happened. A little while later prison officials

hole and accused of being an accomplice.

Since this past Friday night he has been sleeping on the floor.  He is not
being given his mail.  Many of his letters have been returned to the
senders.  His telephone calls have been restricted to one phone call which
he can make Thursday of this week.  They have also eliminated visists from
his family.  We will not be able to see him.  It is obvious that what they
want to do is to isolate him and to prevent any communication with us.

right-wing sectors in Puerto Rico.  Many have gotten their jobs as jailers,
prison guards, as a result of the interevention and influence of a
politician in the right-wing of the New Progressive Party (PNP).  This
accounts for the cruel and inhuman treatment by some of the prison guards
against those of us who have been jailed for civil disobedience.

Ismael Guadalupe Torres
21644-069
MDC  Guaynabo
P.O. BOX  2147
S.J., PUerto Rico 00922-2147

The Guadalupe Torres Family

support of the de-militarization of Vieques/Puerto Rico!!  Pedro was
released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison and
Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on June
10th, 2003.

Come, discuss, and share with these two amazing brothers!!  Join us in this
unique opportunity to dialogue with youth from Puerto Rico that are doing
the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that we are all
doing!!

We will have a light dinner and beverages!!

Endorsed by:
Network in Solidarity with the People of the Philippines (NISPOP)
DRUM-Desis Rising Up & Moving
YouthPower & Desi Reel Newz
Malcolm X Grassroots Movement
QUILOMBO NYC
Committee for Social Justice in Colombia
Bronx Pryde
El Partido de los Trabajadores Dominicanos
The Code

_________________________________________________________________
Protect your PC - get McAfee.com VirusScan Online  
http://clinic.mcafee.com/clinic/ibuy/campaign.asp?cid=3963

Subject:Ismael Guadalupe Torres Is Free!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging people to open up their calendars
and plan to attend the following activities!!  Make sure to visit our
website for any additional information: http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com

ALSO, ISMAEL GUADALUPE TORRES, THE LAST VIEQUES POLITICAL PRISONER, WAS 
FREED FROM MDC GUAYNABO YESTERDAY TUESDAY JUNE 10TH, PLEASE SCROLL DOWN TO 
READ ABOUT HIS RELEASE AND SEE HIM IN PERSON AT OUR YOUTH ENCOUNTER ON 
FRIDAY JUNE 27, 2003!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com
__________________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD YOUTH ENCOUNTER 2003
FRIDAY JUNE 27TH, 2003 AT 6:30PM
HUNTER COLLEGE WEST BUILDING ROOM 217
E68TH ST. LEXINGTON AVENUE
TAKE THE 6 TRAIN TO E68TH ST AND HUNTER COLLEGE

Join the ProLibertad Youth/Student Network and The ProLibertad Freedom
Campaign for our 2nd Annual Youth Encounter with former Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner,  Pedro Colon Almenas, and Current Vieques Political
Prisoner, Isamel Guadalupe Torres.

Both Pedro and Ismael are youth activists in Puerto Rico that have been
incarcerated for their political WORK on behalf of Vieques and in the
support of the de-militarization of Vieques/Puerto Rico!!  Pedro was
released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison and
Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on June
10th, 2003.

Come, discuss, and share with these two amazing brothers!!  Join us in this
unique opportunity to dialogue with youth from Puerto Rico that are doing
the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that we are all
doing!!

We will have a light dinner and beverages!!

Endorsed by:
Network in Solidarity with the People of the Philippines (NISPOP)
DRUM-Desis Rising Up & Moving
YouthPower & Desi Reel Newz
Malcolm X Grassroots Movement
QUILOMBO NYC
Committee for Social Justice in Colombia
Bronx Pryde
El Partido de los Trabajadores Dominicanos
The Code
The Prison Moritorium Project
__________________________________________________________________________________

Ismael Guadalupe Torres was released from MDC Guaynabo on Tuesday June 10, 
2003 at 7:45 am after serving a 140 day sentence for engaging in acts of 
civil disobedience during the last round of bombing in Vieques, Puerto Rico.

Ismael was received by a support rally outside of the prison made of 
friends, family and political comrades.  This support rally organized an 
overnight vigil in front of MDC Guaynabo on Monday June 9, 2003 in order to 
receive Ismael bright and early on Tuesday.

Ismael Guadalupe Torres will be visitng New York City on Friday June 27, 
2003 as a keynote presenter at the 2nd Annual ProLibertad Youth Encounter!!

_________________________________________________________________

Subject:ProLibertad Youth Encounter and Picnic
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign urges all our supporters and Allies to 
attend our 2nd Annual YOuth Encounter next Friday and meet Pedro and Ismael, 
two amazing brothers incarcerated for their political beliefs and actions in 
  the struggle for Vieques and social justice in Puerto Rico.

ALSO, ProLibertad is organizing another Freedom Picnic on saturday July 
19th, 2003!!  Scroll down and find out about how you can support our 
campaign work and get to have FUN AND PARTY!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://ProLibertadWeb.tripod.com
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_________________________________________________________________________________

FRIDAY JUNE 27TH, 2003 AT 6:30PM
PROLIBERTAD YOUTH ENCOUNTER 2003
HUNTER COLLEGE WEST BUILDING ROOM 217
E68TH ST. LEXINGTON AVENUE
TAKE THE 6 TRAIN TO E68TH ST AND HUNTER COLLEGE

Join the ProLibertad Youth/Student Network and The ProLibertad Freedom 
Campaign for our 2nd Annual Youth Encounter with former Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoner, Pedro Colon Almenas, and Current Vieques Political 
Prisoner, Isamel Guadalupe Torres. Both Pedro and Ismael are youth activists 
in Puerto Rico that have been incarcerated for their political WORK on 
behalf of Vieques and in the support of the de-militarization of 
Vieques/Puerto Rico!!

Pedro was released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison 
and Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on 
June 10th, 2003. Come, discuss, and share with these two amazing brothers!! 
Join us in this unique opportunity to dialogue with youth from Puerto Rico 
that are doing the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that 
we are all doing!! We will have a light dinner and beverages!!
__________________________________________________________________________________

SATURDAY JULY 19TH, 2003 AT 9AM
COME TO THE PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC
AT HIGHLAND POOLS IN RINGWOOD, NEW JERSEY

Bring your swimming trunks for the chemical free steam fed ponds!!  We will 
have food, FUN, music, dancing, games, sports and relaxation!! Help us raise 
money for the Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Commissary Fund!!

JOIN US FOR A DOMINOES TOURNAMENT, SPORTS AND RELAXATION!!

Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our 
Freedom Vans to HighLand pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10 adult/$5 for children), Entrance to HighLand 
Pools ($5) and Food ($5). So the full cost is $20 for adults and $15 for 
children!!

Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our Freedom Vans by calling 
718-601-4751/212-927-9065 or email ProLibertad@...

_________________________________________________________________

Subject:FBI ARRESTS IN VIEQUES!!
Message:

READ ABOUT THE CURRENT REPRESSIVE ACTIONS THE FBI ARE TAKING AGAINST THE 
VIEQUES STRUGGLE!!  SCROLL DOWN AFTER OUR CALENDAR FOR A PRESS RELEASE FROM 
THE COMMITTEE FOR THE RESCUE AND DEVELOPMENT OF VIEQUES!!

COME TO THE PROLIBERTAD YOUTH ENCOUNTER AND HEAR ABOUT WHAT IS HAPPENING IN 
VIEQUES; THE ARRESTS, REPRESSION AND RESISTANCE!!
__________________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign urges all our supporters and Allies to
attend our 2nd Annual YOuth Encounter next Friday and meet Pedro and Ismael,
two amazing brothers incarcerated for their political beliefs and actions in 
the struggle for Vieques and social justice in Puerto Rico.

19th, 2003!!  Scroll down and find out about how you can support our
campaign work and get to have FUN AND PARTY!!

Committee for the Rescue and Development of Vieques
P.O.   Box  1424         Vieques,     Puerto    Rico   00765
Tel. 787  741-0716  Fax 787 741-0358  E mail:  bieke@...
http://www.prorescatevieques.org   http://groups.yahoo.com/group/bieke_pr/

25 June, 2003  Press Release

FBI arrest Vieques leader, Nilda Medina

Shortly before 5AM today, five agents of the FBI entered the home of Nilda 
Medina and Robert Rabin, members of the Committee for the Rescue and 
Development of Vieques (CRDV) with a warrant to arrest Medina, acusing her 
of violation of Title 18 of the Federal Code for "damage to property''.  
Teodoro Lebron was the agent in charge of the operation that included 
members of the Puerto Rican police.  The arrest order was signed by 
Magistrate Aida Delgado and Special Agent of the FBI, Carlos Rodr�guez.

Members of the CRDV and the Vieques community denounced the arresta as an 
abuse against a woman who has been a example of this struggle for peace and 
made great efforts over the past four years to maintain the non violent 
nature of the struggle that gained the respect of people throughout the 
world.

This arrest comes just four days after FBI agents entered the facilities of 
the CRDV in the Peace and Justice Camp, with a search warrant to find "maps, 
photos, phone and address lists or other materials as evidence of the 
commission of a crime."

Nilda Medina is recognized as one of the principal leaders of the Vieques 
struggle during more than two decades and is a founding member of the CRDV.  
During actions of civil disobedience, Medina was arrested on May 4th, 2000 
and again in June of that year when she participated in the first brigade to 
return to the bombing zone after the "removal'' of the Civil Disobedience 
Camps from the military area.

Spokespersons for the CRDV also denounce the arrest of others in Vieques and 
in the main island that could take place today and emphasized that the group 
continues its plan to hold a Peopl's Assembly this Thursday at 7PM in the 
Count Mirasol Fort on Vieques to discuss strategies for this new phase of 
the struggle for decontamination, return of the lands to the people and 
sustainable development.

_________________________________________________________________
Protect your PC - get McAfee.com VirusScan Online  
http://clinic.mcafee.com/clinic/ibuy/campaign.asp?cid=3963

VIEQUES; THE ARRESTS, REPRESSION AND RESISTANCE!!

attend our 2nd Annual YOuth Encounter next Friday and meet Pedro and Ismael,
two amazing brothers incarcerated for their political beliefs and actions in 
the struggle for Vieques and social justice in Puerto Rico.

FRIDAY JUNE 27TH, 2003 AT 6:30PM
PROLIBERTAD YOUTH ENCOUNTER 2003
HUNTER COLLEGE WEST BUILDING ROOM 217
E68TH ST. LEXINGTON AVENUE
TAKE THE 6 TRAIN TO E68TH ST AND HUNTER COLLEGE

Join the ProLibertad Youth/Student Network and The ProLibertad Freedom
Campaign for our 2nd Annual Youth Encounter with former Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner, Pedro Colon Almenas, and Current Vieques Political
Prisoner, Isamel Guadalupe Torres. Both Pedro and Ismael are youth activists
in Puerto Rico that have been incarcerated for their political WORK on
behalf of Vieques and in the support of the de-militarization of
Vieques/Puerto Rico!!

Pedro was released from MDC Guaynabo in February 2003 after a year in prison
and Ismael is the last Vieques Political Prisoner, who will be released on
June 10th, 2003. Come, discuss, and share with these two amazing brothers!!
Join us in this unique opportunity to dialogue with youth from Puerto Rico
that are doing the same liberation, de-militarization and anti-war work that
we are all doing!! We will have a light dinner and beverages!!
__________________________________________________________________________________

SATURDAY JULY 19TH, 2003 AT 9AM
COME TO THE PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC
AT HIGHLAND POOLS IN RINGWOOD, NEW JERSEY

Bring your swimming trunks for the chemical free steam fed ponds!!  We will
have food, FUN, music, dancing, games, sports and relaxation!! Help us raise
money for the Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Commissary Fund!!

JOIN US FOR A DOMINOES TOURNAMENT, SPORTS AND RELAXATION!!

Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10 adult/$5 for children), Entrance to HighLand
Pools ($5) and Food ($5). So the full cost is $20 for adults and $15 for
children!!

718-601-4751/212-927-9065 or email ProLibertad@...

25 June, 2003  Press Release

FBI arrest Vieques leader, Nilda Medina

Shortly before 5AM today, five agents of the FBI entered the home of Nilda 
Medina and Robert Rabin, members of the Committee for the Rescue and 
Development of Vieques (CRDV) with a warrant to arrest Medina, acusing her 
of violation of Title 18 of the Federal Code for "damage to property''.  
Teodoro Lebron was the agent in charge of the operation that included 
members of the Puerto Rican police.  The arrest order was signed by 
Magistrate Aida Delgado and Special Agent of the FBI, Carlos Rodr�guez.

Members of the CRDV and the Vieques community denounced the arresta as an 
abuse against a woman who has been a example of this struggle for peace and 
made great efforts over the past four years to maintain the non violent 
nature of the struggle that gained the respect of people throughout the 
world.

This arrest comes just four days after FBI agents entered the facilities of 
the CRDV in the Peace and Justice Camp, with a search warrant to find "maps, 
photos, phone and address lists or other materials as evidence of the 
commission of a crime."

Nilda Medina is recognized as one of the principal leaders of the Vieques 
struggle during more than two decades and is a founding member of the CRDV.  
During actions of civil disobedience, Medina was arrested on May 4th, 2000 
and again in June of that year when she participated in the first brigade to 
return to the bombing zone after the "removal'' of the Civil Disobedience 
Camps from the military area.

Spokespersons for the CRDV also denounce the arrest of others in Vieques and 
in the main island that could take place today and emphasized that the group 
continues its plan to hold a Peopl's Assembly this Thursday at 7PM in the 
Count Mirasol Fort on Vieques to discuss strategies for this new phase of 
the struggle for decontamination, return of the lands to the people and 
sustainable development.
